I’ll send over some of the data graphed tomorrow.

	Let me know if you have any questions.

metadata.subject: Re: Press 35 & 36 Updates - Temperature Feedback PID Loop Test Runs: Steam Automation

messages.content: RE: Press 35 & 36 Updates - Temperature Feedback PID Loop Test Runs: Steam Automation

My pleasure Joe.  Yes sir I understand that the process HMH has implemented doesn’t require precise readings, feedback, etc., so I definitely don’t want anyone to feel like I am questioning things or coming across as an auditor.  The only thing is that when we implement this automated control systems, we must program in as precise measurements as possible for a baseline that the controller can operate from.  But I am handling all of this already as I am manually entering the Fluke readings into the data logs via the HMI, and I only shoot specific areas on the platens that are ~1” in diameter that will give me the highest temp of the platen.  See attached for a graph I just generated from the testing I was doing last night.

 

So, if the operators are going to be taking measurements of the platens and documenting them to compare against the automation system, I would request that we make sure they know where the hottest area is on each platen, and to document the small lower reading from the IR gun instead of the larger one for the reasons I mentioned previously.  Using that smaller read out from the IR gun will give them the highest value within the ranges you mentioned below.  Also If an operator were to shoot this black spot below on the bottom platen of press 36, they would not receive an accurate reading of the highest temp as there is no section within that circle that reaches it.  There are areas in the black circles of several platens that can off by 10° or more from the hottest reading.

 



 

I would be happy to show the operators where the specific 1” diameter spots are on each platen that I am shooting.  I could also show someone in management if you all don’t want me to give them any directives.  Over time I have gotten to know many of the operators very well here and they are great guys….definitely don’t want to ruffle any feathers, etc., again these are just suggestions\recommendations.

 

I am not sure I understand your question highlighted below, we currently have two thermocouples installed on each platen that are secured with a custom block that I had manufactured, and the probes are in direct contact with the platens.  Please let me know if this is not what you were referring to.

 



 

Thank you,

Miguel 

 

Miguel​​​​ Grillo	
Automation Consultant	
office	
(713) 944‑2100	
cell	
(713) 446‑2879	

From: Incavo, Joseph <Joseph.Incavo@hmhw.com> 
Sent: Friday, May 24, 2024 12:55 PM
To: Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com>
Cc: Walker, Chad <Chad.Walker@hmhw.com>; Baran, David <David.Baran@hmhw.com>; Guillen, Enrique <Enrique.Guillen@hmhw.com>; Farzana, Nusrat <Nusrat.Farzana@hmhw.com>; Deruyter, Marty <Marty.Deruyter@hmhw.com>; Estrella, Robert <Robert.Estrella@hmhw.com>; Morales, Rogelio <Rogelio.Morales@hmhw.com>; Waller, Davidt <Davidt.Waller@hmhw.com>; Wallace, David <David.Wallace@hmhw.com>
Subject: RE: Press 35 & 36 Updates - Temperature Feedback PID Loop Test Runs: Steam Automation

 

Many thanks Miguel.

 

This highlights the inherent problem with using emissive guns as our primary temperature measurement tool.  

HHP has done the best they can with standardizing on a painted spot, but the reality is the operator is still always presented with a spread of values. 

 

Question:  is there a thermocouple probe that can measure temp at the existing spot on the platen without presenting a safety issue ?

 

 

Regards,

Joseph Incavo, Ph.D.

Engineering Director

Elastomer Center of Excellence

Tel: 346-267-6913 

joseph.incavo@hmhw.com <mailto:joseph.incavo@hmhw.com>   |  https://hmhw.com <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/5O45CNkjQziZgnyyi4veBL?domain=hmhw.com/>  

SDS JFK
3300 North Sam Houston Pkwy East, Houston, TX 77032, USA



   

 

 

 

Internal

From: Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com <mailto:miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com> > 
Sent: Friday, May 24, 2024 12:45 PM
To: Incavo, Joseph <Joseph.Incavo@hmhw.com <mailto:Joseph.Incavo@hmhw.com> >
Cc: Walker, Chad <Chad.Walker@hmhw.com <mailto:Chad.Walker@hmhw.com> >; Baran, David <David.Baran@hmhw.com <mailto:David.Baran@hmhw.com> >; Guillen, Enrique <Enrique.Guillen@hmhw.com <mailto:Enrique.Guillen@hmhw.com> >; Farzana, Nusrat <Nusrat.Farzana@hmhw.com <mailto:Nusrat.Farzana@hmhw.com> >; Deruyter, Marty <Marty.Deruyter@hmhw.com <mailto:Marty.Deruyter@hmhw.com> >; Estrella, Robert <Robert.Estrella@hmhw.com <mailto:Robert.Estrella@hmhw.com> >; Morales, Rogelio <Rogelio.Morales@hmhw.com <mailto:Rogelio.Morales@hmhw.com> >; Waller, Davidt <Davidt.Waller@hmhw.com <mailto:Davidt.Waller@hmhw.com> >; Wallace, David <David.Wallace@hmhw.com <mailto:David.Wallace@hmhw.com> >
Subject: RE: Press 35 & 36 Updates - Temperature Feedback PID Loop Test Runs: Steam Automation

 

	CAUTION:This email is originated outside of the HMH organization. Exercise caution when responding, opening attachments, and clicking links. 

Joe,

 

Please review my feedback below in blue and let me know if you have any further questions:

 

We understand you will be correcting each of the 4 thermocouples with an offset value to meet the spec value. For instance, gun value = 280, TC reads 287.5, offset is -7.5.  

Will the display show the corrected TC values so that a comparison of the spec value and the actual (corrected) value will be shown ? The point here is that when we walk up to a display we want to see Spec Value and Actual Value.

            

            Currently we are only displaying the temperature measurement from the thermocouple in contact with the platen.  I will add an additional output field right next to it that will display the “corrected” value with the offset calculated which theoretically would show the operator what value they should be reading when measuring with the Fluke 561 IR Thermometer.  That being said, I think it would be a good idea to have a general discussion about how the operators are using the 561 to determine the temperature, especially if they are going to be comparing with the automation system.  There are only a few specific areas on the platen that will provide the maximum current temperature which I feel we need to use as a baseline.  Furthermore, the operators need to make sure they are documenting the smaller value on the display from the IR gun instead of the larger value.  The smaller value holds the maximum reading during the ~7 second instance of the IR shoot.  Notice below how I am reading within the spray-painted spot for press 36 and the reading is 134, but during the time that I was taking the IR reading, I crossed a section that was 145.  Just wanted to bring this to everyone’s attention, the operators might already be doing this.  I am going to speak with a few of them now to get a better idea of which display value they are noting.

 



 

Will the display also show which step, time in that step, total time, time remaining ?

            

            Yes sir that is already programmed into the PLC\HMI

 

Does the coding provide any flagging of setpoints not met after some period of time ? 

            

            Yes sir we have implemented time-based thresholds that will alarm\alert and take action if feedback is out of a specific range from the setpoint for a specific period of time.  I can send that information later if you want and we can always adjust it if needed, I will add an “admin” section as well on the HMI where specific users can change those parameters if needed.

messages.content: RE: Press 35 & 36 Updates - Temperature Feedback PID Loop Test Runs: Steam Automation

Joe,

 

Please review my feedback below in blue and let me know if you have any further questions:

 

We understand you will be correcting each of the 4 thermocouples with an offset value to meet the spec value. For instance, gun value = 280, TC reads 287.5, offset is -7.5.  

Will the display show the corrected TC values so that a comparison of the spec value and the actual (corrected) value will be shown ? The point here is that when we walk up to a display we want to see Spec Value and Actual Value.

            

            Currently we are only displaying the temperature measurement from the thermocouple in contact with the platen.  I will add an additional output field right next to it that will display the “corrected” value with the offset calculated which theoretically would show the operator what value they should be reading when measuring with the Fluke 561 IR Thermometer.  That being said, I think it would be a good idea to have a general discussion about how the operators are using the 561 to determine the temperature, especially if they are going to be comparing with the automation system.  There are only a few specific areas on the platen that will provide the maximum current temperature which I feel we need to use as a baseline.  Furthermore, the operators need to make sure they are documenting the smaller value on the display from the IR gun instead of the larger value.  The smaller value holds the maximum reading during the ~7 second instance of the IR shoot.  Notice below how I am reading within the spray-painted spot for press 36 and the reading is 134, but during the time that I was taking the IR reading, I crossed a section that was 145.  Just wanted to bring this to everyone’s attention, the operators might already be doing this.  I am going to speak with a few of them now to get a better idea of which display value they are noting.

 



 

Will the display also show which step, time in that step, total time, time remaining ?

            

            Yes sir that is already programmed into the PLC\HMI

 

Does the coding provide any flagging of setpoints not met after some period of time ? 

            

            Yes sir we have implemented time-based thresholds that will alarm\alert and take action if feedback is out of a specific range from the setpoint for a specific period of time.  I can send that information later if you want and we can always adjust it if needed, I will add an “admin” section as well on the HMI where specific users can change those parameters if needed.

 

Thank you,

Miguel

 

 

Miguel​​​​ Grillo	
Automation Consultant	
office	
(713) 944‑2100	
cell	
(713) 446‑2879	

From: Incavo, Joseph <Joseph.Incavo@hmhw.com>

metadata.subject: Re: Press 35 & 36 Updates - Temperature Feedback PID Loop Test Runs: Steam Automation

messages.content: Re: Press 35 & 36 Updates - Temperature Feedback PID Loop Test Runs: Steam Automation

The manual pressure regulators are open to 60 psi for 35 & 36, and I have the valves fully closed right now in manual mode.  If by chance you all need to put them in service and I’m not there, just move the slider bar to 100 on the HMI screens and then the operators can control the steam manually.  I also have that laptop live 24/7 that I can log into remotely anytime if needed.


Sent from my iPhone


Miguel​​​​ Grillo	
Automation Consultant	
office	
(713) 944‑2100	
cell	
(713) 446‑2879	
	On May 24, 2024, at 12:48 AM, Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com> wrote:
	
	

	﻿ 

	Dave,

	 

	The loops for 36 appear to be running great now and I am ready to run another part through whenever you all are able to schedule it.  I shouldn’t have to make any adjustments this time during the cure cycle(it will run in full auto).

	 

	Attached is the raw data for the past few days for Press 36, and here is a video <https://www.loom.com/share/0bcd3d4f899f4e9383d4cb0cd8c68d57?sid=8cded687-ca1a-4537-a541-76c059eb16f6>  of the real time PID loop graph(black line is setpoint, green line is temp feedback from thermocouple) for the top platen along with intervals where you can see me shoot the same spot with the IR Thermometer.  I’ll send over some of the data graphed tomorrow.

	 

	I noticed today that there is a mechanical issue with Press 35 and it’s currently out of service, so I am taking the opportunity to tune the loops for those platens, and I will probably be ready by end of tomorrow to run a part through that one as well.

	 

	Let me know if you have any questions.

	 

	Thank you,

	Miguel

	 

	From: Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com> 
	Sent: Thursday, May 23, 2024 12:46 AM
	To: Waller, Davidt <Davidt.Waller@hmhw.com>
	Cc: Walker, Chad <Chad.Walker@hmhw.com>; Baran, David <David.Baran@hmhw.com>; Guillen, Enrique <Enrique.Guillen@hmhw.com>; Farzana, Nusrat <Nusrat.Farzana@hmhw.com>; Deruyter, Marty <Marty.Deruyter@hmhw.com>; Incavo, Joseph <Joseph.Incavo@hmhw.com>; Estrella, Robert <Robert.Estrella@hmhw.com>; Morales, Rogelio <Rogelio.Morales@hmhw.com>
	Subject: RE: Temperature Feedback PID Loop Test Runs: Steam Automation

	 

	Dave,

	 

	I had a feeling something wasn’t right about the thermocouples today.  Upon further investigation this evening when I came back onsite, I realized that our wiring technician swapped the top right and bottom left TCs and landed them in the wrong channels of the PLC IO cards.  I updated the PLC configuration and now the loops are running great.  There is still a temp offset, but the loops are much more stable now.  I’ll send over data in the morning.

	 

	Also, just FYI, I brought a laptop that I am leaving here next to the panel that will always be on and connected to the system.  This will allow me to remotely log in so that I can keep tuning the loops over the weekend, when I am not onsite, etc.

	 

	I plan on tunning more presses tomorrow and will be in touch.

	 

	Thank you,

	Miguel 

	 

	

	<image001.png>
	

	 

Miguel​​​​ Grillo

Automation Consultant

office

(713) 944‑2100

cell

(713) 446‑2879

messages.content: RE: Payment Clarification Needed - AWC Invoices - Dynamis

DeShanti,

 

Sorry for the delay as we were working on making sure everything is lined up correctly.

 

Here is the update for the next set of invoices for the two units that we are delivering tomorrow.  I’ll have feedback later today or tomorrow on the remaining ones.

 



 

Attached are the invoices along with the revised POs we received. If you could please help to push these through for payment next week that would be appreciated.  These orders we part of a progressive payment agreement we have so several of the original progressive invoices are severely past due.

 

Let me know if you have any questions or need anything else.

 

Thank you for the help!

 

Miguel

 

Miguel​​​​ Grillo	
Automation Consultant	
office	
(713) 944‑2100	
cell	
(713) 446‑2879

RE: Temperature Feedback PID Loop Test Runs: Steam Automation

Dave,

 

I had a feeling something wasn’t right about the thermocouples today.  Upon further investigation this evening when I came back onsite, I realized that our wiring technician swapped the top right and bottom left TCs and landed them in the wrong channels of the PLC IO cards.  I updated the PLC configuration and now the loops are running great.  There is still a temp offset, but the loops are much more stable now.  I’ll send over data in the morning.

 

Also, just FYI, I brought a laptop that I am leaving here next to the panel that will always be on and connected to the system.  This will allow me to remotely log in so that I can keep tuning the loops over the weekend, when I am not onsite, etc.

 

I plan on tunning more presses tomorrow and will be in touch.

 

Thank you,

Miguel 

 



 

Miguel​​​​ Grillo	
Automation Consultant	
office	
(713) 944‑2100

(713) 446‑2879

Subject: Re: Temperature Feedback PID Loop Test Runs: Steam Automation

 

Great to hear.  Dave, because undercure is bad and cross-link density plateaus once fully cured, we want specs to be "minus 0, plus X" with X being as small as possible. We've intended to write that into HEMPS, but not sure it has made it.   In tires we used rtds to control in tenths but those are short cures.  Good work all !

Joe

Subject: RE: Dynamis and Evolution 

 

Tracy,

 

Please review my feedback below in blue.

 

 

These accounts are continuously past due and we don’t seem to be able to get clarity on the process break downs. We discovered yesterday that Dynamis orders which are on progressive terms are not being managed from the operational side.

*	One of the purposes of progressives is to set payment milestones and manage those against our tech partner/supplier obligations.  We learned yesterday, that the sales/operations team is authorizing work and purchases even if Dynamis has not met the milestone payments. This is concerning.

 

*	This is all on me for not staying on top of these orders and am working with working with Luke on the remaining builds to make sure we follow the progressive payment terms process accurately.

 

*	Luke and I made sure we had verbiage in the proposal which Dynamis accepted related to non-cancellable\non-returnable once a PO was received.

 



 

*	Main issue that caused the progressives to become convoluted is that our proposal was for 7 panels at one price, and then Dynamis sent over 7 individual orders according to the units being built



 

*	Then Dynamis added scope to the builds and gave us 7 separate orders for the additional scope 



 

 

*	I am working with Alan and Luke to revise the remaining progressive payment orders\invoices to accurately represent their revised orders.

 

*	Dynamis has no issues with any of our terms, paying progressive payments or cash flow in general, they just have more volume than they can handle, and it affects their ability to accurately receive deliveries in their system.  It’s primarily a personnel issue.  This is also on me as I have been meaning to sit with them to help in their receiving process and spoke with them yesterday and am meeting with them this Thursday.

 

*	Things will be much smoother with them related to invoicing, payments, etc., moving forward.

 

 

Let me know if you have any questions or need more information.  Apologies again for now responding sooner.

 

Thank you,

Miguel

Subject: FW: Correct Case 04498380 PO 4511291535



 

Hi Andre,

 

I tried to phone you just now, but your voicemail said you were not accepting phone calls.

 

We received this PO from AWC for Hydril.

 

We have questions about the number of redundancy options that are in the order.  

 

Pos. 009 – 015: 2 servers -> Should they be redundant? If yes, then the option WinCC OA Redundancy for the 2 servers is missing => please add 2x the MLFB 6AV6351-1FP31-6AA0 - WinCC OA Redundancy

 

Pos. 017 – 024: 2 redu servers (= 4 licenses – 7 desktop UI each)  These should be good.

 

Pos. 027 – 034 : 3 redu servers (= 6 licenses – 6 desktop UI each) -> Should every server be redundant? If yes, then the option WinCC OA Redundancy for 1 redu server is missing => please add 2x the MLFB 6AV6351-1FP31-6AA0 - WinCC OA Redundancy

 

Let me know if you have any questions.

 

Best regards,

 

Rick McMullan

 

Systems Engineer 

Siemens Industry, Inc.
RC-US DI FA PRD HMI
Tel.: +1 214 213-5651
Mobile: +1 214 213-5651
mailto:rick.mcmullan@siemens.com <mailto:rick.mcmullan@siemens.com> 

Siemens Customer Support Hotline: (800) 333-7421

messages.content: RE: Temperature Feedback PID Loop Test Runs: Steam Automation

Dave,

 

See attached for a longer test run that I ran today on the top platen for Press 36.  Working on correcting the initial ramp up overshoot but otherwise we stayed within the +/- 5deg, still room for improvement though overall on the loop which I will continue to do.  This test also simulated a cure step change with setpoint increasing.

 

I’m running a test right now on the bottom platen for Press 36 with adjustment to correct initial overshoot.

 

I’ll probably be ready tomorrow to run a full automated cycle for a regular part number that goes inside 36(with nothing in it though initially).  Once that’s done, I will send you the results and I assume once you sign off on it, we can run an automated cycle whenever it has a real part(it’s been idle for several days which has actually been great for me to test).

 

Now that I have a fairly close PID parameter set, I should be able to apply it to all of the other presses and just make small adjustments if needed.

 

Will keep you posted.

 

Thank you,

Miguel

 

Miguel​​​​ Grillo	
Automation Consultant	
office	
(713) 944‑2100	
cell	
(713) 446‑2879

messages.content:
Paula,

 

I will be at Dynamis tomorrow afternoon and have a meeting scheduled specifically to help them improve their receiving process so that this does not keep happening.

 

Their remaining current past due amount will be paid within the next 1-2 weeks.

 

Just wanted to let you know.

 

Thank you,

Miguel

cell	
(713) 446‑2879

I will schedule a meeting for us to discuss. 

 

Thanks

Paula

Cc: Luke Rodrigue <luke.rodrigue@awc-inc.com <mailto:luke.rodrigue@awc-inc.com> >; Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com <mailto:miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com> >; Tracy Spafford <tracy.spafford@awc-inc.com <mailto:tracy.spafford@awc-inc.com> >
Subject: FW: Dynamis and Evolution 

 

Paula,

 

Read Miguel’s responses below.   I am sure you still have question, concerns, needs, and expectations to address.  When you are ready, call a meeting for me, Miguel, and Luke to attend so we can work through this and make the situation better for all involved.  If you would rather pass emails back and forth as our means to address concerns, needs, and expectations we can do that.

 

Tracy

 

Tracy​​​​ Spafford

VP Automation Technology

office

(713) 944‑2100

cell

(281) 635‑7557

From: Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com <mailto:miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com> > 
Sent: Tuesday, May 7, 2024 1:59 PM
To: Tracy Spafford <tracy.spafford@awc-inc.com <mailto:tracy.spafford@awc-inc.com> >
Cc: Luke Rodrigue <luke.rodrigue@awc-inc.com <mailto:luke.rodrigue@awc-inc.com> >
Subject: RE: Dynamis and Evolution 

 

Tracy,

 

Please review my feedback below in blue.

 

 

These accounts are continuously past due and we don’t seem to be able to get clarity on the process break downs. We discovered yesterday that Dynamis orders which are on progressive terms are not being managed from the operational side.

*	One of the purposes of progressives is to set payment milestones and manage those against our tech partner/supplier obligations.  We learned yesterday, that the sales/operations team is authorizing work and purchases even if Dynamis has not met the milestone payments. This is concerning.

 

*	This is all on me for not staying on top of these orders and am working with working with Luke on the remaining builds to make sure we follow the progressive payment terms process accurately.

 

*	Luke and I made sure we had verbiage in the proposal which Dynamis accepted related to non-cancellable\non-returnable once a PO was received.

 



 

*	Main issue that caused the progressives to become convoluted is that our proposal was for 7 panels at one price, and then Dynamis sent over 7 individual orders according to the units being built



 

*	Then Dynamis added scope to the builds and gave us 7 separate orders for the additional scope 



 

 

*	I am working with Alan and Luke to revise the remaining progressive payment orders\invoices to accurately represent their revised orders.

 

*	Dynamis has no issues with any of our terms, paying progressive payments or cash flow in general, they just have more volume than they can handle, and it affects their ability to accurately receive deliveries in their system.  It’s primarily a personnel issue.  This is also on me as I have been meaning to sit with them to help in their receiving process and spoke with them yesterday and am meeting with them this Thursday.

 

*	Things will be much smoother with them related to invoicing, payments, etc., moving forward.

 

 

Let me know if you have any questions or need more information.  Apologies again for now responding sooner.

 

Thank you,

Miguel

 

 

Miguel​​​​ Grillo

Automation Consultant

office

(713) 944‑2100

cell

(713) 446‑2879

Cc: Tracy Spafford <tracy.spafford@awc-inc.com <mailto:tracy.spafford@awc-inc.com> >

Luke and Miguel,

 

Read the email stream below.  What needs to be done to better the situation and what needs to be done to keep this situation from recurring?  Once you guys have all the information together to bring me up to speed, call a meeting for us to discuss and be ready for a meeting with Paula and her team.

 

Tracy

Tracy

Tracy

I know you were not able to make yesterday’s meeting on Dynamis. Please let me know when you have time to meet on Dynamis and Evolution. They are our #2 and #8 past due. 

 



 

These accounts are continuously past due and we don’t seem to be able to get clarity on the process break downs. We discovered yesterday that Dynamis orders which are on progressive terms are not being managed from the operational side.

*	One of the purposes of progressives is to set payment milestones and manage those against our tech partner/supplier obligations.  We learned yesterday, that the sales/operations team is authorizing work and purchases even if Dynamis has not met the milestone payments. This is concerning.

 

I discussed with Luke and Miguel yesterday that we will start to work down Dynamis’ credit limit until we can get this resolved.

 

I believe it is time to get Alan and Anthony with Dynamis’ finance/accounting team to get a better understanding of the situation and the problems they are seeing from there end that are preventing them from paying on time.

 

We also need to have discussions with Evolution. They are also stretching payments beyond terms on a regular basis, although admittedly they seem to be able to better manage the situation.

 

Thanks

Paula

We have a fast-paced project deploying the first week of July for 7xDE2.5’s. Please let me know as soon as possible, as the timeline is critical.

 

Colleen

messages.content:
Tracy,

 

Please review my feedback below in blue.

 

 

These accounts are continuously past due and we don’t seem to be able to get clarity on the process break downs. We discovered yesterday that Dynamis orders which are on progressive terms are not being managed from the operational side.

*	One of the purposes of progressives is to set payment milestones and manage those against our tech partner/supplier obligations.  We learned yesterday, that the sales/operations team is authorizing work and purchases even if Dynamis has not met the milestone payments. This is concerning.

 

*	This is all on me for not staying on top of these orders and am working with working with Luke on the remaining builds to make sure we follow the progressive payment terms process accurately.

 

*	Luke and I made sure we had verbiage in the proposal which Dynamis accepted related to non-cancellable\non-returnable once a PO was received.

 



 

*	Main issue that caused the progressives to become convoluted is that our proposal was for 7 panels at one price, and then Dynamis sent over 7 individual orders according to the units being built



 

*	Then Dynamis added scope to the builds and gave us 7 separate orders for the additional scope 



 

 

*	I am working with Alan and Luke to revise the remaining progressive payment orders\invoices to accurately represent their revised orders.

 

*	Dynamis has no issues with any of our terms, paying progressive payments or cash flow in general, they just have more volume than they can handle, and it affects their ability to accurately receive deliveries in their system.  It’s primarily a personnel issue.  This is also on me as I have been meaning to sit with them to help in their receiving process and spoke with them yesterday and am meeting with them this Thursday.

 

*	Things will be much smoother with them related to invoicing, payments, etc., moving forward.

 

 

Let me know if you have any questions or need more information.  Apologies again for now responding sooner.

 

Thank you,

Miguel

 

 

Miguel​​​​ Grillo	
Automation Consultant	
office	
(713) 944‑2100	
cell	
(713) 446‑2879

These accounts are continuously past due and we don’t seem to be able to get clarity on the process break downs. We discovered yesterday that Dynamis orders which are on progressive terms are not being managed from the operational side.

*	One of the purposes of progressives is to set payment milestones and manage those against our tech partner/supplier obligations.  We learned yesterday, that the sales/operations team is authorizing work and purchases even if Dynamis has not met the milestone payments. This is concerning.

 

I discussed with Luke and Miguel yesterday that we will start to work down Dynamis’ credit limit until we can get this resolved.

 

I believe it is time to get Alan and Anthony with Dynamis’ finance/accounting team to get a better understanding of the situation and the problems they are seeing from there end that are preventing them from paying on time.

 

We also need to have discussions with Evolution. They are also stretching payments beyond terms on a regular basis, although admittedly they seem to be able to better manage the situation.

 

Thanks

Paula

Cc: Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com>; Michael Davis <Michael.Davis@awc-inc.com>
Subject: 4/25- Siemens Follow Up

 

Hi Team!

 

Thanks so much for your time yesterday.

 

Below are the action items and misc. notes from our discussion. Be prepared this is a long one.

Outdoor Comfort Panel 

*	(21) in-stock at AWC
*	(45) not ordered

	*	Fleet 14- (7 total, one quote)

		*	(7)- Delivery ASAP- need quote from EWS.

	*	Fleet 15 - (19 total, two separate quotes)

		*	(7) Delivery Oct- need quote from EWS.
		*	(12) Delivery Oct- EWS team already quoted in kit but need to order.

	*	Fleet 16- (19 total, two separate quotes)

		*	(7) Delivery Oct- need quote from EWS.
		*	(12) Delivery Oct - EWS team already quoted in kit but need to order.

*	NATALIE to work on expediting as soon as I get SO/PO information.

 

Monitor for Data Vans

*	Industrial Flat Panel – IFP1500 (6AV78635MA002AA0)

	*	See attached data sheet.
	*	I already ordered you a sample.

*	MIGUEL to send you a quote.

 

Siemens Drives

*	Based on the application, I am recommending us quoting a G120X. (See attached power point)
*	NATALIE to get a sample of 10 HP - 6SL3220-3YE24-0UF0.
*	MIGUEL to send quote for:

	*	7.5 HP -6SL32203YE220UF0  
	*	10 HP- 6SL3220-3YE24-0UF0
	*	20 HP- 6SL3220-3YE28-0UF0

*	Specifications:

	*	Does have STO.
	*	Does have PROFINET.
	*	Good news, you would not have to change your program because the PROFINET will allows us to match telegram structure in the drive.

 

Licenses

*	NATALIE to set up time with AE, Rohit, to show functionalities of Multiuser.

 

Training

TIA Portal Programming 1

*	6/17/2024-6/20/2024- at AWC Houston
*	10/28/2024-10/31/2024- at AWC Houston
*	We could also schedule a private training at an EWS/Jelec facility with a fee associated.

PRONETA

*	I know we discussed scheduling some time to train your team to effectively use PRONETA. Could you give me a head count of how many individuals need to be trained, as well as a couple of options for dates? (Johnny)
*	My suggestion would be to set up time with either AWC or Siemens application engineer.

	*	Natalie to ask---Does running PRONETA impact PLC communication ??? What are best practices.

 

Test Stand

*	NATALIE & MIGUEL to coordinate.

 

If I left anything off, please let me know.

 

Have a great weekend!

 

Best Regards,

 

Natalie Turner

 

SIEMENS 

Digital Industries – Totally Integrated Automation

Houston, Texas

The HMI is receiving it’s IP address now through DHCP, I have to update the firmware of the PLC before I can set it to DHCP and will do that in the next day or so.

 

I had to set the HMI back to its static IP so it could go back online with the PLC and the presses.  I’ll set it back to DHCP tomorrow while I am there so you can reconfigure the VLAN, once that’s done I will go back and test on Robert’s system in his office to confirm communications.

Subject: 4/25- Siemens Follow Up

 

Hi Team!

 

Thanks so much for your time yesterday.

 

Below are the action items and misc. notes from our discussion. Be prepared this is a long one.

Outdoor Comfort Panel 

*	(21) in-stock at AWC
*	(45) not ordered

	*	Fleet 14- (7 total, one quote)

		*	(7)- Delivery ASAP- need quote from EWS.

	*	Fleet 15 - (19 total, two separate quotes)

		*	(7) Delivery Oct- need quote from EWS.
		*	(12) Delivery Oct- EWS team already quoted in kit but need to order.

	*	Fleet 16- (19 total, two separate quotes)

		*	(7) Delivery Oct- need quote from EWS.
		*	(12) Delivery Oct - EWS team already quoted in kit but need to order.

*	NATALIE to work on expediting as soon as I get SO/PO information.

 

Monitor for Data Vans

*	Industrial Flat Panel – IFP1500 (6AV78635MA002AA0)

	*	See attached data sheet.
	*	I already ordered you a sample.

*	MIGUEL to send you a quote.

 

Siemens Drives

*	Based on the application, I am recommending us quoting a G120X. (See attached power point)
*	NATALIE to get a sample of 10 HP - 6SL3220-3YE24-0UF0.
*	MIGUEL to send quote for:

	*	7.5 HP -6SL32203YE220UF0  
	*	10 HP- 6SL3220-3YE24-0UF0
	*	20 HP- 6SL3220-3YE28-0UF0

*	Specifications:

	*	Does have STO.
	*	Does have PROFINET.
	*	Good news, you would not have to change your program because the PROFINET will allows us to match telegram structure in the drive.

 

Licenses

*	NATALIE to set up time with AE, Rohit, to show functionalities of Multiuser.

 

Training

TIA Portal Programming 1

*	6/17/2024-6/20/2024- at AWC Houston
*	10/28/2024-10/31/2024- at AWC Houston
*	We could also schedule a private training at an EWS/Jelec facility with a fee associated.

PRONETA

*	I know we discussed scheduling some time to train your team to effectively use PRONETA. Could you give me a head count of how many individuals need to be trained, as well as a couple of options for dates? (Johnny)
*	My suggestion would be to set up time with either AWC or Siemens application engineer.

	*	Natalie to ask---Does running PRONETA impact PLC communication ??? What are best practices.

 

Test Stand

*	NATALIE & MIGUEL to coordinate.

 

If I left anything off, please let me know.

 

Have a great weekend!

 

Best Regards,

 

Natalie Turner

 

SIEMENS 

Digital Industries – Totally Integrated Automation

Houston, Texas

Hey Shawn,

 

Thank you for the order!  I am working on pushing this through so that your license can be delivered next week.  In the meantime, can you please have the attached filled out minus the last page since you already supplied that information?

 

Let me know if you have any questions or need help with the form.

 

Thank you,

Miguel

 

Miguel​​​​ Grillo	
Automation Consultant	
office	
(713) 944‑2100	
cell	
(713) 446‑2879	

From: Shawn Sandoval <shawns@kaasm.com> 
Sent: Friday, April 19, 2024 11:49 AM
To: Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com>
Subject: Fwd: AWC Quote - Kaasm: Siemens STEP 7 Professional V18/2021 SR1 Combo(TIA Portal) DVD

 

Hi Miguel,

 

Here is the purchase order, W9, and reseller permit. Please note the the "ship to" address:

 

Shawn Sandoval

12115 Cunliffe Rd SW

Vashon, WA 98070

 

 

Thanks,


 

SHAWN SANDOVAL 

Direct: 206.375.3697

shawns@kaasm.com <mailto:shawns@kaasm.com>  | KAASM <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/LMOqC73zNQtzk2kDu8q8mG?domain=kaasm.com/> 

 

 

On Fri, Apr 19, 2024 at 9:30 AM Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com <mailto:miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com> > wrote:

	Hey Shawn,

	 

	That’s funny about the voice memo….I did drag that message on for a bit!

	 

	Yeah, I actually prefer the DVD method as well due to the same issues you mentioned, just didn’t know if you needed to look for all possible areas to cut costs.

	 

	Attached is a quote we can use to get things going, and we will need to set Kaasm up as a new customer in our system which will require you to fill out our new customer form, etc., let me know if you would like to proceed and I can send that your way.

	 

	You could then place an order with net 30 payment terms if you wanted to apply for a credit account with us, or you could pay with a credit card.

	 

	As far as registering the software with Siemens, it would be no issue registering directly to your customer if you want, we will just need their name, email, title, phone number and address once we place the order.  Other option is to register the software to someone from Kaasm.  Most of our customers register the software to themselves, but we do have a few that register their end client.

	 

	That should cover everything, let me know if you have any questions.

	 

	Thank you,

	Miguel

	 

	 

Miguel​​​​ Grillo

Automation Consultant

office

(713) 944‑2100

cell

(713) 446‑2879

	To: Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com <mailto:miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com> >
	Subject: Re: Quote request

	 

	Hi Miguel,

	 

	Thanks for the voicemail. At one point, I was trying to talk to you before remembering it was just a voice memo🤣 

	 

	The customer is Boeing and they are not running on the latest and greatest. I've bought OSD before form other vendors and they just fuck it up everytime. Not to say you will...However, Just getting the DVD will be fine. If you can get me .85 from list cost, that will work. Just so we are on the same page:

	 

	List = $5520

	.85 = $4692

	 

	My purchase order will be for $4692.

	 

	I know you will need software registration. Since this will be for Boeing in Washington state, how do you want to handle that?

	 

	 

	Thanks,

	 

	SHAWN SANDOVAL 

	Direct: 206.375.3697

	shawns@kaasm.com <mailto:shawns@kaasm.com>  | KAASM <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/LMOqC73zNQtzk2kDu8q8mG?domain=kaasm.com/> 

	 

	 

	On Thu, Apr 18, 2024 at 3:53 PM Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com <mailto:miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com> > wrote:

		Can you get me 20 points on this? If so, the purchase order is yours. Please let me know.

		 

		 

		Cheers,

		
		

		SHAWN SANDOVAL  |  KAASM

Subject: 2024 Property Tax Protest

 

Happy Monday! 

 

Another year, another property tax protest – please let me know whether or not you would like me to file a protest for you this year. Whether your value has increased (blech) or decreased (yay), I would recommend filing a protest. If there’s nothing to be done, we can always withdraw with no fee from me.

 

If you have an outstanding balance from last year, I’ll contact you directly to settle up. Additionally, if I’ve fallen off your account as agent, I’ll send you a new appointment of agent form to sign via Adobe.

 

If you have any outstanding repairs that need to be done, please start getting your written repair estimates. Remember, you don’t have to complete the repair, but we need a written repair estimate to be able to discuss this during the protest.

messages.content: AWC Quote - Kaasm: Siemens STEP 7 Professional V18/2021 SR1 Combo(TIA Portal) DVD

Hey Shawn,

 

That’s funny about the voice memo….I did drag that message on for a bit!

 

Yeah, I actually prefer the DVD method as well due to the same issues you mentioned, just didn’t know if you needed to look for all possible areas to cut costs.

 

Attached is a quote we can use to get things going, and we will need to set Kaasm up as a new customer in our system which will require you to fill out our new customer form, etc., let me know if you would like to proceed and I can send that your way.

 

You could then place an order with net 30 payment terms if you wanted to apply for a credit account with us, or you could pay with a credit card.

 

As far as registering the software with Siemens, it would be no issue registering directly to your customer if you want, we will just need their name, email, title, phone number and address once we place the order.  Other option is to register the software to someone from Kaasm.  Most of our customers register the software to themselves, but we do have a few that register their end client.

 

That should cover everything, let me know if you have any questions.

 

Thank you,

Miguel

 

 

Miguel​​​​ Grillo	
Automation Consultant	
office	
(713) 944‑2100	
cell	
(713) 446‑2879	

From: Shawn Sandoval <shawns@kaasm.com> 
Sent: Thursday, April 18, 2024 7:57 PM
To: Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com>
Subject: Re: Quote request

 

Hi Miguel,

 

Thanks for the voicemail. At one point, I was trying to talk to you before remembering it was just a voice memo🤣 

 

The customer is Boeing and they are not running on the latest and greatest. I've bought OSD before form other vendors and they just fuck it up everytime. Not to say you will...However, Just getting the DVD will be fine. If you can get me .85 from list cost, that will work. Just so we are on the same page:

 

List = $5520

.85 = $4692

 

My purchase order will be for $4692.

 

I know you will need software registration. Since this will be for Boeing in Washington state, how do you want to handle that?

 

 

Thanks,

 

SHAWN SANDOVAL 

Direct: 206.375.3697

shawns@kaasm.com <mailto:shawns@kaasm.com>  | KAASM <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/czFhCR6n2EcGLQgks9lhzZ?domain=kaasm.com/>

Subject: Siemens Step 7 License Issue

 

Hi Miguel/Fernando,

 

We’re dealing with an urgent issue with Siemens Step 7 licensing, and the technician with the issue is currently on an offshore rig with poor internet connectivity.

 

The error message is 

“Automation License Manager (0086:000300) License ‘STEP 7 Professional’ was not found.”

 

*	Step 7 version is V16.
*	His computer has V15 floating license and V16 upgrade license.
*	Previously, he had a V16 trial license as well.
*	Once trial license expired, the ALM was unable to find/point to the permanent license, even after we deleted the trial license.
*	We tried to transfer the licenses to a USB drive and then transfer back to the computer.
*	We also verified that the ALM service is running.

 

Could you assist us on this matter?

Please let us know if you need any additional information.

 

 

Thanks,

 

Nathan Wang

Steve/Paul,

 

I apologize for not sending this out last week as intended.

 

I have discussed your request with the team, and pending your approval, we would like to transition Miles Mascarella from IES to the role of full-time, on-site drafter.

 

Miles has been serving as both an Electrical Supervisor, overseeing the wiring and test-book teams, and as an Instrumentation/Mechanical Technician working directly on test-book functions.

 

He has extensive AutoCAD experience and has been involved with the layout portion of your drawing packages since late last year. In his new role, Miles will continue to serve as the on-site Electrical Supervisor in addition to his duties as the on-site AutoCAD drafter. This dual role will help reduce costs.

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

Thank you,

Miguel

Subject: CNX Unit 2 Wiring Issues

 

Hi Rami,

 

There is a wiring issue dealing with breaker 12FC2. Taylor and Jhossept are correcting the issue.

 

Everytime the PLC calls for the oil priming pump the 12FC2 breaker trips.

	Sent: Friday, April 12, 2024 12:33 PM
	To: Miles Mascarella <mmascarella@iespecialist.com>
	Subject: RE: Din rail mount 
	 

	Hello Miles,

	 

	After conferring with my boss and a quick review of our warranty documentation it appears that the warranty only covers the unit itself and not the mounting hardware.

	 

	If you are interested in replacement Din rail mounts there is a 5-pack available on our website here: https://www.rtautomation.com/product/din-rail-mount-5-pack/ <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/Y9U_Crk5yzirGmj4I7UCSM?domain=rtautomation.com/> 

	These mounts and similar ones are available elsewhere as well.

	 

	As I mentioned on the phone, it looks like there was a sheer force of some kind applied to the mount when they were removed previously.

	This caused the retention bracket over the spring to break off and it appears to have sheared off the mounting point on the moving portion of the mount as well.

	Not 100% sure how this would have happened as the amount of force required to do that would be rather significant so it may have been a weak mount.

	I would just be careful removing them in the future and ensure you push down and rotate when removing them from the Din rail.

	 

	I will be on the lookout for any other reports of similar issues in case there was a bad batch of mounts.

	 

	Let me know if you have any questions.

	 

	Thanks,

Marty,

 

I will be there with our installation technicians this coming Monday the 15th to work on some final items including the installation of 3 pressure transmitters, one each on the steam lines for Presses 28, 33, 34.

 

Would it be possible to shut them down staggered that day?  So for example have 28 shut off overnight so we can start working on it at 6:30am, then 33 shut off so we can work on it a few hours after, etc.

 

We are flexible and don’t want to disturb production as much as possible so if we need to do it in another manner please let me know.

 

Thank you,

Miguel

David,

 

Apologies for being MIA lately!  Things should be back to normal moving forward.

 

Per our conversation this morning, please review the attached and below and let me know if you have any questions.  The pricing in this proposal reflects the closest we can get to pricing out the units the same.

 

As you can see below, the 1518 is a little more of a higher-end processor than the 1516 as it has more load and working memory, faster processor cycle time, and has a 4th communications interface on-board.  This is also reflected by the ~16% delta in the list(MSRP) price provided by Siemens.

 

We can work on expediting these with Siemens if needed once you place the order.  I have also confirmed that our Siemens distributor in China has plenty of stock in the 1518’s if you needed to bring some in immediately.

Dhcp is preferred.  We will have the ports configured for vlan 60 and they will get an ip address based on their mac address

In any case we will have to adjust the port configuration for the switch ports the devices will be plugged into.

Joseph Frederick

Hey Ryan,

 

Steve Rodriguez with Dynamis registered for the upcoming Basics of PLC class this Friday but he would like to give his spot to his colleague Nathan Sommer( nathan.sommer@dynamisps.com <mailto:nathan.sommer@dynamisps.com>  ).

 

Would you be able to make this switch or does someone else handle registration, etc.?

 

Thank you,

Miguel

 <https://www.awc-inc.com/>

cell	
(713) 446‑2879	
HOW ARE WE DOING? <https://ww2.awc-inc.com/emailfeedback.aspx?ref=262>

Paula,

 

I will be at the Dynamis facilities most of the day today, and this topic was already a top priority that we are planning to discuss.  The majority of the 795K past due for Dynamis is related to their receiving department being unable receive sub-assemblies in their system, along with their request to revise the two large service invoices, 3125829(121K) & 3128955(136K), so they are broken out per system being worked on.  I was at Dynamis last week and both of these issues that are causing the delay in payment were already being addressed, so today will be a final wrap up and I will request that they send a wire transfer this week.

 

Per my weekly call with Alan, we were letting A/R handle the collections for Evolution, but it looks like I will need to get involved now and will reach out to them today as well.

 

I will report back on both of these accounts later this afternoon.

 

Let me know if you have any further questions or concerns.

 

Thank you,

 

Miguel A. Grillo

Automation Consultant

4940 Timber Creek

Houston, TX 77017

Cell: 713-446-2879

24/7 Tech Support: 800-411-8400

Thanks

Paula

Operating System Support - HMH: 1931525-22 Panasonic Toughbook 54 Kits

Amine\Cris,

 

Panasonic is no longer offering Windows 10 as an option for these Toughbooks and will only ship them with Windows 11.

 

We tried our best to have them make an exception for us, but they wouldn’t budge.

 

Please let me know if HMH would approve delivery with Windows 11.

 

Our only other option would be to proceed with ordering a single Toughbook with Win 11 and see if one of our techs can install a copy of Win 10 on it, not sure if the new Panasonic motherboard\chipset would support Win 10 though.

 

Let me know your thoughts on how we should proceed.

 

Thank you,

Miguel

 <https://www.awc-inc.com/> 	
awc-inc.com <https://www.awc-inc.com/>

Automation Consultant

Sent from my iPhone

Begin forwarded message:



 <https://www.awc-inc.com/> 	
awc-inc.com <https://www.awc-inc.com/> 
	
Miguel​​​​ Grillo

HOW ARE WE DOING? <https://ww2.awc-inc.com/emailfeedback.aspx?ref=262> 	
	From: Emily Blackman <email@renweb.com>
	Date: March 25, 2024 at 4:08:28 PM CDT
	To: Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com>
	Subject: SCM Parent Permission and Waiver to View Solar Eclipse
	Reply-To: Emily Blackman <eblackman@stcathmont.org>
	
	

	﻿ 

	Good afternoon, St. Catherine’s Parents –

	 

	On Monday, April 8, 2024, a total solar eclipse <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/0T5xCXDwmNF4Ql6rT65a4h?domain=science.nasa.gov/>  will cross North America, during which Houston will experience a partial eclipse at approximately 1:30 PM. This will be the last total solar eclipse visible from the contiguous United States until 2044.

	 

	Safety is a priority at St. Catherine’s, and we will take precautionary measures for the *on-campus students and employees to make this a safe and enjoyable experience.

	 

	*	Parents must complete and submit this waiver <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/WZ0TCYExoOHD7K0BuGTc8n?domain=stcathmont.org>  by Wednesday, April 3 to grant their child permission to participate using eclipse glasses
	*	St. Catherine’s will provide eclipse glasses for *on-campus students and employees
	*	No one will be permitted to look at the eclipse without wearing the provided glasses
	*	Students who have not been granted parental permission via submission of the waiver will remain indoors during the eclipse

	 

	*Upper Elementary students will be in Colorado for their field trip and therefore outside the solar eclipse path. Infant Community and Primary AM children will not be on campus during the eclipse. 

	 

	Remember: St. Catherine’s must receive a waiver granting your child permission to view the eclipse using eclipse glasses by Wednesday, April 3.

	 

	Please contact me with any questions.

	
	

	Cheers,

	Emily

	 

	Emily Blackman

	
	 <https://stcm-tx.client.renweb.com/ftp/stcm-tx/Email/12043/WsoGwUfT_1657546401800.png> 

	 

	9821 Timberside • Houston, Texas 77025

	713.665.2195  |  fax 713.665.1478

	stcathmont.org <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/BZjjC1wqxKu64rjWtXx0Vf?domain=stcathmont.org/>

Subject: RE: EXPENSE REPORTS REMINDER
Importance: High

 

Good morning everyone!

 

Year end is here!  Please note that although the policy states all expense reports should be completed monthly and within 90 days of the expenses, all current year expense reports must be completed and approved by January 8th 2024.

 

Below are some year-end tips/reminders for processing expense reports with the full policy available on .NET <https://ww2.awc-inc.com/help/Accounting/Procedures/FIN-001%20Expense%20Reimbursement%20and%20Travel%20Procedure.pdf>  under ? > Home > Procedures > Accounting/Credit > Expense Reports.

1.	Under Expense Report Entry, be sure the calendar year is correct for the year of the expenses.



2.	After starting a New Expense Report, be sure the Date is for the month of the expenses NOT the date the expense report is completed.



3.       Expense reports should be submitted monthly for that month’s expenses. 

4.       Always hold your receipts until your expense report has been approved and paid by accounting.

5.       Each expense date entered should match the date on the receipt.



6.	Be sure your receipts are detailed, clear, and legible.

 

 Below is a reminder of account coding per the policy:





 

 

Let us know if you have any questions or cannot meet this critical deadline.

 

Thanks

 

 

 

 

 

 <https://www.awc-inc.com/> 

awc-inc.com <https://www.awc-inc.com/> 

Linda​ Molaison

To: Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com <mailto:miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com> >
Subject: Reported Email

 

Hey Miguel,

 

We received a phishing email you had reported (I put a screenshot below for reference) and I wanted to let you know we really appreciate you taking the time to do that.

 

It looks like you used the Mimecast plug-in to report the email and I wanted to let you know we have a new and improved way to report emails like this one called the PhishAlert Button (PAB). 
When you use the PAB, it will actually scan the email to determine if it is a threat, and if it is, it can automatically quarantine that email in everyone’s mailbox that received it! That will give us time to review it without the risk of another person clicking on any links or opening any attachments before we can take action.

 

The PAB will be in the ribbon at the top of Outlook and looks like the reference below.

messages.content:
Gary,

 

Natalie has informed me that you have been inquiring about an urgent need for some of the of the 6AV21240QC130AX0 HMIs.

 

Currently we have 7 units ready in our warehouse for orders that were placed by Evolution in case you are able to pull from those:

 



 

If you need me to send the Evolution POs for your reference just let me know.

 

I am also working with Natalie to see if we can get the price down to the levels of the regular 15” panel.

 

Let me know if you have any further questions or needs.

 

Thank you,

Miguel

 <https://www.awc-inc.com/> 	
awc-inc.com <https://www.awc-inc.com/> 
	
Miguel​​​​ Grillo	
Automation Consultant	
office	
(713) 944‑2100	
cell	
(713) 446‑2879	
HOW ARE WE DOING? <https://ww2.awc-inc.com/emailfeedback.aspx?ref=262>

Chris,

 

Thank you for your time at the end of the day yesterday to discuss our continued partnership.  Apologies for the extremely long email and the following italicized text captures the core message:

 

I’m expressing a strong commitment to the AWC-EnQuest partnership and addressing issues with Toa's misunderstanding of industrial automation technologies, such as PLCs, HMIs, and Ethernet protocols.  I highlight several incidents where Toa's lack of technical understanding led to inefficiencies, and I offer detailed examples of Toa's misconceptions. Despite these challenges, I remain dedicated to supporting all EnQuest projects, offering extensive help beyond our initial scope, and I propose further assistance with configuring and programming a variety of equipment to ensure project success.

 

My commitment to the AWC-EnQuest partnership remains strong, and I'm here 24/7 for anything you all need.

 

Yesterday’s escalation in tension with Toa stems from his persistent inclination to jump to conclusions and assign blame without proper troubleshooting, but more importantly without the basic understanding of the technology behind Industrial Ethernet, PLCs and HMIs and their roles in an automation system.

 

Here are a few examples related to his misunderstanding of basic concepts:

 

1.	Being unable to distinguish between a PLC which contains the application’s logic algorithm, and an HMI which is merely an interface into the PLC
2.	Yesterday, Toa was equating a basic network IP ping function, which merely confirms network presence, with functional Modbus TCP client\server communications.
3.	Last week he was referring to standard Ethernet connectivity as a “Modbus TCP connection”. 

 

At one-point last week I felt it was necessary to give Toa a detailed overview of all the different networking protocols (Modbus TCP, Profinet, Ethernet I/P, etc.) and how those differ from the physical media they are being transmitted across (twisted copper, industrial ethernet, RJ45 connections, etc.).

 

Sharing knowledge and expertise in Ethernet-based communication protocols and industrial automation is something I genuinely enjoy. Educating others about these topics is both rewarding and integral to fostering understanding and collaboration with our partners such as EnQuest.

 

I don’t share this information as a judgment on Toa’s his intellect, I can see how brings a lot of value to EnQuest with his knowledge of power, gensets, switchgear, etc.

 

Rather I just want to emphasize, as you know, that the nuances of industrial automation, and its various communication protocols, require a significant amount of time and experience to grasp. These are highly technical fields that take years to master, and when someone doesn’t have at minimum a basic understanding, and then attempts to integrate with a team that does, it can lead to inefficiencies and production bottlenecks. 

 

Toa’s constant behaviors focusing on argumentation over understanding not only hinders effective communication but also impacts productivity.  In several recent instances where Toa clearly has no understanding of the technology being discussed, he begins to argue with me as to why he is right until I must explain to him in detail how automation and industrial communication systems work.

 

These small 3-5 minute interactions, which are constantly occurring, start to add up throughout the day, and after 8-10 of them, you can start closing in an hour or more worth of time that could have been focused on productive work to push things forward.

 

Over the past two weeks, I’ve dedicated extensive time at your facility, and remotely, configuring the new Toshiba VFDs and ABB ATS for Modbus TCP communications. This work, while not explicitly within AWC's scope, is part of our collaborative effort to ensure system readiness, and I am always happy and eager to help with this if needed and will continue to do so.

 

The only reason I am bringing this to your attention is because of several comments I heard from Toa during this period of time, along with a text message I received from him yesterday morning, where the general message coming from him is “your PLC and HMI are the issue, and we are waiting on you”.

 

So I had to explain to Toa that any non-Siemens equipment that will be communicating with the PLC\HMI should technically already be configured and tested prior to us coming on site to finish the automation configuration. Monday morning was actually the first time that I was able to download and test the updated Siemens PLC\HMI configuration that was revised to work with the Toshiba VFDs and ABB ATS.

 

I understand that the departure of a controls savvy resource like Rudy presents challenges, and the last thing I want to do is complicate things further. While working with Toa under these circumstances is not without its difficulties, I will continue to offer my full support in its current form if necessary to ensure project continuity and success.

 

That said, I would like to offer one option for your consideration:

 

1.	I propose to extend my support further by offering to set up, configure, and program a wide range of equipment, beyond just Siemens products, at your facility as required to support your manufacturing and production operations. This includes configuring, preparing, and testing all Modbus TCP slave devices (VFDs, ATS, etc.) in addition to the Siemens PLC and HMIs.

 

2.	All we would need to do is communicate your production and testing schedule so I could make sure and coordinate times to configure and test all devices at your facility as early as possible before the units get to test line, then I would come back and be onsite as long as required while they are on test line. 

 

3.	I would be your automation technical lead and would require minimal support from EnQuest unless I had a question for a manufacturer.

 

4.	You could think of me as an extension of your team until you all bring on a controls\automation resource, a subcontractor at no cost.

 

I truly hope this message is conveyed as one of a constructive mutual understanding of how we can work through some of the current challenges so that we can all ensure a successful rollout of these Genset units and many other innovate EnQuest applications on the horizon.

 

I am happy to meet and discuss any of these topics or anything else anytime.

 

Thank you,

 

Miguel A. Grillo

Automation Consultant

4940 Timber Creek

Houston, TX 77017

Office: 713-944-2100 x625

Cell: 713-446-2879

24/7 Tech Support: 800-411-8400

www.awc-inc.com <http://www.awc-inc.com>

From: email@renweb.com <email@renweb.com> On Behalf Of St. Catherine's Montessori
Sent: Wednesday, March 6, 2024 3:49 PM
To: Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com>
Subject: A note about SCM's Grandparents & Special Friends Day

 

Hello Parents,

 

As you know, Grandparents & Special Friends Day is coming up on Thursday, March 28, 2024. We mailed invitations to grandparents last week using the addresses you provided in FACTS Family Portal.

 

If your child would like to invite a special friend (godparents, aunts, uncles, great-grandparents, etc.) to share the morning at school, please pass along the attached invitation. We ask that all guests RSVP by Monday, March 25.

 

This year, to help guests find their children’s classrooms more easily, we will ask them to check in at the Welcome Center to receive a pre-printed card with their name, the names of the children they will visit, and the guides’ names. Cheerful signs and staff members will be present to help with wayfinding. To assist with this process, please encourage friends and family members to RSVP. 

 

We look forward to welcoming grandparents and friends to St. Catherine’s Montessori for this very special day!

 

 

 

 <https://stcm-tx.client.renweb.com/ftp/stcm-tx/Email/12043/WmH2yQzK_1655482024601.png> 


9821 Timberside • Houston, Texas 77025

phone 713 665 2195  |  fax 713 665 1478

stcathmont.org <mailto:lray@stcathmont.org>

Sent: Monday, March 18, 2024 9:10 AM
To: Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com>
Subject: Yearbook Deadline Reminders - Recognition ad deadline is TODAY

 

Dear SCM Parents,

 

Please take a moment to review the deadlines outlined below for the yearbook. Your attention to these dates is greatly appreciated to ensure the smooth production of this year's publication.

 

Today is the deadline to create and purchase your yearbook recognition ads.

 

Recognition Ad Deadline

A final reminder that the deadline for creating and purchasing yearbook recognition ads is today, Monday, March 18. Please note that this is a firm deadline as our yearbook is due for print next week. Click here <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/2Lq4CyP5QKT7w1AnCZ67b6?domain=stcathmont.org>  for more information on pricing and designing recognition ads.

	
Help Capture Memories for the Yearbook

If you've taken photos at school events throughout the year (Saturday Soccer, Sociables, sports games, Going Outs, etc.) we would love to include them in the yearbook! Please send any photos you're willing to share to jochoa@stcathmont.org <mailto:jochoa@stcathmont.org>  by Monday, March 25.

	
Ordering a Yearbook

In keeping with our commitment to sustainability, we will not order extra copies of the yearbook this year. The March 25th deadline will be your last opportunity to purchase a yearbook for the 2023-2024 school year. You can order your yearbook through the Herff Jones <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/dKC0Czp5VLuGZ1OLSX6pQR?domain=yearbookordercenter.com>  website. Our school order number is: 25676.

 

Thank you,

Jocelyn

	On March 8, 2024 at 12:19:12 AM UTC, miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com <mailto:miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com>  wrote:

		Hello, this email never made it into my CU list. The email address is correct.

		 

		 

		 

		Miguel A. Grillo

		Automation Consultant

		4940 Timber Creek

		Houston, TX 77017

		Office: 713-944-2100 x625

		From: ClickUp Support <help@clickup.com <mailto:help@clickup.com> > 
		Sent: Tuesday, March 5, 2024 6:20 PM
		To: Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com <mailto:miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com> >
		Subject: Live Chat Follow-up: Outllook (#1686652)

		 

		Hey, Miguel!
		 
		Thank you for your patience! 🙇 
		 
		I'd like to address all the issues you raised.
		 
		First, the recurring subtasks <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/YdSMCW6vkMc6KqYWtL6FIy?domain=help.clickup.com>  that you have are set to recur only when closed. This kind of task will not recur and change the due date unless you mark them as Closed/Completed first. I suggest using the On Schedule <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/TLnfCW6vkMc6KqYWt6LX5M8?domain=help.clickup.com>  setting instead so it automatically recurs even if the current status is still Not Started or Active.
		 
		 <https://clickup.zendesk.com/attachments/token/nu1YZ05i82a5g20YYCCWDzN3C/?name=image.png> 
		 


		Emails from Tasks


		Task details are intended not to be included in emails created from the comments. If you want to include some details from the task, I'd recommend creating an Email Automation <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/kEKWCZ6yqPc7LgRpcmp3rW?domain=help.clickup.com>  to capture the task details and then use that to start an email thread with the task details. Please see the sample Automation below.
		 
		 <https://clickup.zendesk.com/attachments/token/dqjvUCMPuE4nIfLo9xEvwb0pX/?name=2024-03-06_07-59-33+%281%29.gif> 
		 
		Once the Automated email is sent, you can reply to that and add or change the recipient to start a thread with the task details in the email.
		 
		 <https://clickup.zendesk.com/attachments/token/a8EykX1YrLqUUOf44ORvuZFCX/?name=2024-03-06_08-05-11+%281%29.gif> 
		 


		Inbox Notifications


		Please note that actions made by you will not trigger an in-app notification for yourself. If you are sending or forwarding emails to a ClickUp List from your email address, it will not trigger a notification in the Inbox.
		 
		The 99 notifications on the Other <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/7PPJC31vBMuXlKMEc8CT4r?domain=help.clickup.com>  tab means there are 99 notifications about changes in tasks that you are watching. It doesn't necessarily mean the same number of tasks you have in the Workspace.
		 
		You can read what type of notifications you get for each tab here <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/wR8FC4xwENTzO5Wvc8q8Wc?domain=help.clickup.com> . We divided it into different tabs to help declutter and organize all types of notifications.
		 


		Add Guests


		This help article <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/9CggC5yxJOfM79KDI38MiB?domain=help.clickup.com>  has clear instructions on how to add guests. I confirm that you have 10 free guest seats that you can fill.
		 
		Please make sure you understand the difference between full members and guests as adding users as members will charge your account.
		 
		Guests <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/C5iuC68yLPuPvm9BU1yit_?domain=help.clickup.com>  are usually people outside your organization with limited access to your Workspace. They can only see the items you share with them.
		 
		All paid plans <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/D1f8C73zNQtzKN6Jc5D-aL?domain=clickup.com>  let you choose different permission <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/0MmyC82APRIX0qMKcxPOCT?domain=help.clickup.com>  levels for guests and shared items. If allowed, those guests can create and edit tasks. They can't create Spaces, Folders, or Lists.
		 
		Members <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/oyXvC9rBRVIzXqKpcJ7ij8?domain=help.clickup.com>  are the people in your organization who need to use your Workspace actively. They have access to all public items and your plan's features. They can create and edit Spaces, Folders, Lists, and tasks.
		 
		If you want to learn more, check out this article: User Roles <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/oyXvC9rBRVIzXqKpcJ7ij8?domain=help.clickup.com> .
		 


		Closing tasks


		I understand you want to easily close tasks when you open them similar to Notion's task behavior. At this time, clicking outside the task on the sidebar will not close the task. Esc or Escape button on your keyboard is the ClickUp hotkey in closing tasks.
		 
		You can learn more about the other hotkeys here <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/HaFBC0RpvJTk5BWLc1g1Ri?domain=help.clickup.com> .
		 
		I wish you a wonderful day! Contact us anytime you have questions. 🌷 
		 
		 
		Cheers!
		 
		Alex

 

 

 

 <https://ca.slack-edge.com/E03113FF70B-U03JBQCS0CS-98829fca5a12-512> 

 

 <https://clickup.com/emails/images/brand/v2/logo.png> 

 

 

Alex

ClickUp 3.0 is here! Learn more about what's new in these frequently asked questions <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/edWpCR6n2EcG1WlzFoKNQ_?domain=dev-doc.clickup.com> !

		 

		 

		On March 4, 2024 at 5:08:39 PM UTC, miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com <mailto:miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com>  wrote:

			Thank you, Alex!

			 

			1.	Re CLK-475130 please add the following to this ticket as they are related: I have Due Date triggers set on repeat daily (including weekends) yet they do not repeat so I have to go in manually daily. See video: https://sharing.clickup.com/clip/p/t9014148638/927159d1-ee02-49eb-89fa-b7a7f2ddccdf/screen-recording-2024-03-04-10%3A51.webm <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/fH1TCjRM7oTYXmJvF9RWoA?domain=sharing.clickup.com> 
			2.	Re Inbox: thanks for the video, please see mine in response: https://sharing.clickup.com/clip/p/t9014148638/02107a5c-5757-4584-959e-8de58d3998fd/screen-recording-2024-03-04-10%3A55.webm <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/FyxkCkRK9pTkjB0pcZsKAT?domain=sharing.clickup.com> 
			3.	NEW: Can you walk me through how to add a guest user without being charged for another seat? This seems very complex and the instructions online are not accurate, and I believe that I was give 5 guest user seats with my subscription.
			4.	NEW: Is there a way to simply click out of a task once opened instead of having to hit the X? Notion does this and it’s very helpful. See video: https://sharing.clickup.com/clip/p/t9014148638/f3bfa27d-82ff-47b7-9e14-3a9a747217dc/screen-recording-2024-03-04-11%3A01.webm <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/rHm2ClYLjqh18EKvuk4geK?domain=sharing.clickup.com> 

			 

			I appreciate your support, thanks very much!

			 

			 

			Miguel A. Grillo

			Automation Consultant

			4940 Timber Creek

			Houston, TX 77017

			Office: 713-944-2100 x625

			Cell: 713-446-2879

			24/7 Tech Support: 800-411-8400

			www.awc-inc.com <http://www.awc-inc.com> 

			 

			From: ClickUp Support <help@clickup.com <mailto:help@clickup.com> > 
			Sent: Sunday, March 3, 2024 6:58 PM
			To: Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com <mailto:miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com> >
			Subject: Live Chat Follow-up: Outllook (#1686652)

			 

			Hey, Miguel!
			
			I trust that everything is well with you! 🙏
			
			I'm Alex, a member of ClickUp's Technical Support team, and I'm here to assist you in resolving this issue.
			
			I understand that you have several questions about the email features, comments, notifications, and due dates. I'll answer them all below.
			 
			First, the disappearing due date. I tested it and I was able to reproduce the behavior that you described. 
			 
			We've recently confirmed this as unintended behavior and let our Development team know you're also experiencing it. For individual tracking, I've created a report to keep you updated on our team's progress and completion.
			 
			Here is the Report ID: CLK-475130
			 
			In the meantime, you can set the due date and time after opening the task or on the List view to make sure that they save successfully.
			 
			If you would like to check in on the progress sooner, the easiest way to do this is by entering the above ID into our chatbot in our in-app Resource Center for instant updates!
			 


			Inbox


			Inbox <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/iZ1yCmZ6lrIp3lYrImJMAZ?domain=help.clickup.com>  is actually for ClickUp task notifications and not for email. I understand that you want to send and receive emails in ClickUp and that is done within the tasks. You can find all the information here <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/lF5-Cn5XnvCX2DLYclZqee?domain=help.clickup.com>  and I also created a short video explaining it here <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/Gl7vCo2KpwIDRYG0fGOCnQ?domain=dev-share.clickup.com> .
			 


			Comments/Notifications


			We currently have no way to start a conversation when you are creating a task. We can only start messaging other users once the task is already created in the comments section.
			 
			I get that you are concerned about users being notified when a comment is added to a task. This can be set in the individual notification settings <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/1F_4CpYKrxh9WoLBcORVHV?domain=help.clickup.com> . Please note that actions made by you will not trigger a notification for yourself.
			 
			I created another short Clip explaining this here <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/0RgyCqx5wyT13Nrou0T8bF?domain=dev-share.clickup.com> .
			 


			Due Date Mobile Notifications


			We have to make sure that notifications are enabled on both devices. Please go to you mobile settings and make sure that Push notifications for the ClickUp app is enabled.
			 
			If the settings are enabled and you still do not receive consistent notifications, please let me know. Provide us with more information about the devices such as their model and operating system

Regards,

 

Jonathan Holder

 

3000 N Sam Houston Pkwy E

Houston, TX 77032-3219

Jonathan,

 

I just tried calling you at 281-871-2589 but the phone kept ringing.  I will be able to help you with the requested quote below but I have a few questions that need to be addressed before we can proceed.

 

Please call me at your earliest convenience anytime and I am available anytime day or night.

 

Thank you,

 

Miguel A. Grillo

Automation Consultant

To: Grillo, Miguel <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com <mailto:miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com> >
Subject: FW: Request for quote - Halliburton

 

Miguel,

 

Can you quote this for Jonathan?

 

Thanks,

Stacy

 

From: Jonathan Holder <Jonathan.Holder@halliburton.com <mailto:Jonathan.Holder@halliburton.com> > 
Sent: Wednesday, July 17, 2019 9:19 AM
To: Bhatia, Rohit (RC-US DI FA PRD CNT-WST) <rohit.bhatia@siemens.com <mailto:rohit.bhatia@siemens.com> >
Cc: Gonzalez, Stacy (RC-US DI S-TIA R-CW CMC1) <stacy.gonzalez@siemens.com <mailto:stacy.gonzalez@siemens.com> >
Subject: Request for quote - Halliburton

 

Rohit,

 

I need to get a quote for the SIMATIC ET 200iSP (Zone 1) Remote I/O system, with the capability for 24 Digital Inputs and 24 Analog Inputs (non-HART), supplied in a pre-assembled field enclosure.  This will be for installation in a Zone 1 area, with fiber optic networking to the safe area.  Communication via Modbus TCP.  An Unmanaged fiber optic barrier/switch (we will have multiple separate I/O racks in the future) is required in the safe area to network to the remote I/O.  I realize Siemens does not offer a fiber to Ethernet converter/IS barrier so third-party equipment would need to be incorporated into the supplied field enclosure assembly.  Would need to be comparable to MTL 9465-ET or Stahl series 9721.  Can these I/O racks be daisy chained if there is a need for expansion in the future?

 

In addition to pricing, I will need the quote to include lead time on delivery and any obsolescence issues that may arise with this product line.

 

Please include any additional equipment necessary for installation in the quote.  Feel free to contact me immediately if any additional information is needed.  Time is critical on this proposal, so a quick turnaround by Thursday would be appreciated.  Thank you.

 

 

Regards,

 

Jonathan Holder

 

3000 N Sam Houston Pkwy E

Houston, TX 77032-3219

Email: jonathan.holder@halliburton.com <mailto:jonathan.holder@halliburton.com> 

Office: +1 281-871-2589

 

________________________________

Cc: Jagasia, Ravindra <ravindra.jagasia@r-stahl.com>; Nizberg, Marat <marat.nizberg@r-stahl.com>
Subject: AWC Quote - Stahl RIO Zone 1 

 

Gentlemen,

 

Please find the attached proposal for your review and let us know if you have any questions.

 

Thank you,

 

 

 <https://www.awc-inc.com/> 

awc-inc.com <https://www.awc-inc.com/> 

Miguel​ Grillo
