From: Bobby Jackson <Bobby.Jackson2@halliburton.com <mailto:Bobby.Jackson2@halliburton.com> > 
Sent: Wednesday, January 25, 2023 9:48 AM
To: Jagasia, Ravindra <ravindra.jagasia@r-stahl.com <mailto:ravindra.jagasia@r-stahl.com> >
Cc: Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com <mailto:miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com> >; Shaun Lawrence <Shaun.Lawrence@halliburton.com <mailto:Shaun.Lawrence@halliburton.com> >; Paul Brown <Paul.Brown@Halliburton.com <mailto:Paul.Brown@Halliburton.com> >; Nizberg, Marat <marat.nizberg@r-stahl.com <mailto:marat.nizberg@r-stahl.com> >
Subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Stahl

 

NOTE: This is an external message. Please use caution when replying, opening attachments or clicking on any links in this e-mail.

Hi Ravi,

 

At minimum we need:

 

8 Frequency/Counter/Quadrature Channels

8 Digital Input Channels

40 Universal Input/Output Channels (AI,DI,AO, and DO)

 

Thanks,

Bobby

 

From: Jagasia, Ravindra <ravindra.jagasia@r-stahl.com <mailto:ravindra.jagasia@r-stahl.com> > 
Sent: Monday, January 23, 2023 9:06 AM
To: Bobby Jackson <Bobby.Jackson2@halliburton.com <mailto:Bobby.Jackson2@halliburton.com> >
Cc: Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com <mailto:miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com> >; Shaun Lawrence <Shaun.Lawrence@halliburton.com <mailto:Shaun.Lawrence@halliburton.com> >; Paul Brown <Paul.Brown@Halliburton.com <mailto:Paul.Brown@Halliburton.com> >; Nizberg, Marat <marat.nizberg@r-stahl.com <mailto:marat.nizberg@r-stahl.com> >
Subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Stahl

 

Hi Bobby,

 

That is good to hear. I have a question on the re-bound. Does the quadrature device have intrinsically safe interface?

 

Yes, these are configurable 16 channel DIO module and it provides you flexibility to configure the 16 channels as DI or DO, in pairs. Example 10DI+6DO or 12DO + 4 DI. 

But if you are using the DIO module for Quadrature application then some of the IO channels will get blocked for this application.

 

So a break-up of the IO counts will be useful. Can you provide these?

 

Understood, we will focus on the Zone 1.

 

Best regards,  Ravi
T  +1 832 539-6790    |   M  +1 713 497-6388    

 

From: Bobby Jackson <Bobby.Jackson2@halliburton.com <mailto:Bobby.Jackson2@halliburton.com> > 
Sent: Monday, January 23, 2023 07:44
To: Jagasia, Ravindra <ravindra.jagasia@r-stahl.com <mailto:ravindra.jagasia@r-stahl.com> >
Cc: Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com <mailto:miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com> >; Shaun Lawrence <Shaun.Lawrence@halliburton.com <mailto:Shaun.Lawrence@halliburton.com> >; Paul Brown <Paul.Brown@Halliburton.com <mailto:Paul.Brown@Halliburton.com> >; Nizberg, Marat <marat.nizberg@r-stahl.com <mailto:marat.nizberg@r-stahl.com> >
Subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Stahl

 

NOTE: This is an external message. Please use caution when replying, opening attachments or clicking on any links in this e-mail.

Hi Ravi,

 

Paul has taken a look at your suggested modules and has concluded they will work.  Do these modules support DI and DO channels on the same module?  Paul pointed out that this would effect our final module count.

 

Also please note we would like to focus our efforts on finding the solution for the Zone 1, high density panel before moving on to the others.

 

Thanks,

Bobby 

 

From: Jagasia, Ravindra <ravindra.jagasia@r-stahl.com <mailto:ravindra.jagasia@r-stahl.com> > 
Sent: Thursday, January 19, 2023 11:26 AM
To: Bobby Jackson <Bobby.Jackson2@halliburton.com <mailto:Bobby.Jackson2@halliburton.com> >
Cc: Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com <mailto:miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com> >; Shaun Lawrence <Shaun.Lawrence@halliburton.com <mailto:Shaun.Lawrence@halliburton.com> >; Paul Brown <Paul.Brown@Halliburton.com <mailto:Paul.Brown@Halliburton.com> >; Nizberg, Marat <marat.nizberg@r-stahl.com <mailto:marat.nizberg@r-stahl.com> >
Subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Stahl

 

Bobby,

 

I reviewed the attachment you sent on quadrature input processing module and have following questions on re-bound:

 

1.	Our 9470/32 <https://protect-us.mimecast.com/s/d-_hC5yxJOf0rolMF8xhPk?domain=nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com>  (Z1) (exact functional equivalent for Z2 is 9470/33 <https://protect-us.mimecast.com/s/49gPC68yLPuo4EWPfBjYKG?domain=nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com> ) is the DIO module which has the ability to measure frequency / counter. Pg. 40 Section 6.2 of the Ops Manual <https://protect-us.mimecast.com/s/_muJC73zNQtmBvRzU2CDKH?domain=nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com>  refers to the instructions how they can be used. Is this what your application requires? Pls review datasheet & Ops manual in the links and let us know.

 

2.	If not, we would have to work with the quadrature device you currently use.  Note that it is not rated for hazardous area installation and RS 485 output is not rated for Ex areas. How do you currently use it?

 

Pls advise way forward.

 

Best regards,  Ravi
T  +1 832 539-6790    |   M  +1 713 497-6388    

 

From: Bobby Jackson <Bobby.Jackson2@halliburton.com <mailto:Bobby.Jackson2@halliburton.com> > 
Sent: Wednesday, January 18, 2023 09:10
To: Jagasia, Ravindra <ravindra.jagasia@r-stahl.com <mailto:ravindra.jagasia@r-stahl.com> >
Cc: Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com <mailto:miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com> >; Shaun Lawrence <Shaun.Lawrence@halliburton.com <mailto:Shaun.Lawrence@halliburton.com> >; Paul Brown <Paul.Brown@Halliburton.com <mailto:Paul.Brown@Halliburton.com> >; Nizberg, Marat <marat.nizberg@r-stahl.com <mailto:marat.nizberg@r-stahl.com> >
Subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Stahl

 

NOTE: This is an external message. Please use caution when replying, opening attachments or clicking on any links in this e-mail.

Hi Ravi – Please see answers below…

 

-         Shall we assume that the Zone 1 signals are intrinsically safe (IS)? 

o   Yes, Zone 1 signals shall be intrinsically safe

-         What about Zone 2 signals – are they IS or non incendive? 

o   Signals are not required to be IS in Zone 2

 

-         Also, could you pls organize the datasheet of the field device whose output is quadrature? 

o   I don’t have the datasheet for the field device but I’ve attached the datasheet for the module we are looking to replace.

 

-         While we understand your point on not sharing configurations, could you pls let us know the competitor and his product / brand. E.g. Rockwell solutions can be based on ControlLogix or MicroLogix etc. 

o   Pepperl + Fuchs FB Series 

 

Thanks,

Bobby

 

From: Jagasia, Ravindra <ravindra.jagasia@r-stahl.com <mailto:ravindra.jagasia@r-stahl.com> > 
Sent: Tuesday, January 17, 2023 9:34 AM
To: Bobby Jackson <Bobby.Jackson2@halliburton.com <mailto:Bobby.Jackson2@halliburton.com> >
Cc: Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com <mailto:miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com> >; Shaun Lawrence <Shaun.Lawrence@halliburton.com <mailto:Shaun.Lawrence@halliburton.com> >; Paul Brown <Paul.Brown@Halliburton.com <mailto:Paul.Brown@Halliburton.com> >; Nizberg, Marat <marat.nizberg@r-stahl.com <mailto:marat.nizberg@r-stahl.com> >
Subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Stahl

 

Bobby,

 

Appreciate your efforts to get us the answers. And we seek some more clarity.

 

-         Shall we assume that the Zone 1 signals are intrinsically safe (IS)?

-         What about Zone 2 signals – are they IS or non incendive?

 

-         Also, could you pls organize the datasheet of the field device whose output is quadrature?

 

-         While we understand your point on not sharing configurations, could you pls let us know the competitor and his product / brand. E.g. Rockwell solutions can be based on ControlLogix or MicroLogix etc.

 

Hopefully with answers to the above, we can go back to HQ on the pricing…

 

Best regards,  Ravi
T  +1 832 539-6790    |   M  +1 713 497-6388    

 

From: Bobby Jackson <Bobby.Jackson2@halliburton.com <mailto:Bobby.Jackson2@halliburton.com> > 
Sent: Tuesday, January 17, 2023 08:41
To: Nizberg, Marat <marat.nizberg@r-stahl.com <mailto:marat.nizberg@r-stahl.com> >
Cc: Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com <mailto:miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com> >; Shaun Lawrence <Shaun.Lawrence@halliburton.com <mailto:Shaun.Lawrence@halliburton.com> >; Paul Brown <Paul.Brown@Halliburton.com <mailto:Paul.Brown@Halliburton.com> >; Jagasia, Ravindra <ravindra.jagasia@r-stahl.com <mailto:ravindra.jagasia@r-stahl.com> >
Subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Stahl

 

NOTE: This is an external message. Please use caution when replying, opening attachments or clicking on any links in this e-mail.

Hi Marat – Please see specifications below.  While I have no problem providing information to support the business case for the project I don’t think it’s appropriate to list the configuration details supplied by your competitors.

 

Type

Low Density

ATEX / IECEx Zone 1

Thanks,

Bobby

 

From: Nizberg, Marat <marat.nizberg@r-stahl.com <mailto:marat.nizberg@r-stahl.com> > 
Sent: Tuesday, January 17, 2023 7:54 AM
To: Bobby Jackson <Bobby.Jackson2@halliburton.com <mailto:Bobby.Jackson2@halliburton.com> >
Cc: Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com <mailto:miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com> >; Shaun Lawrence <Shaun.Lawrence@halliburton.com <mailto:Shaun.Lawrence@halliburton.com> >; Paul Brown <Paul.Brown@Halliburton.com <mailto:Paul.Brown@Halliburton.com> >; Jagasia, Ravindra <ravindra.jagasia@r-stahl.com <mailto:ravindra.jagasia@r-stahl.com> >
Subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Stahl

 

Bobby,

Can you also please define low/high density and approx.. I/O counts.

 

Best regards, 

Marat Nizberg

Fernando,

 

Please ship the heaters(highlighted attached) this morning on a hotshot to Dynamis and put them to the attention of Chris Solis.  You will probably need to have corporate raise their LOC so the tickets can print.

 

We will ship the rest of the ready hardware probably tomorrow, but I will let you know.

 

Thank you,

 

Miguel A. Grillo

Fernando​​​​ Vargas

office

(713) 378‑7680

From: Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com <mailto:miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com> >

To: Fernando Vargas <Fernando.Vargas@awc-inc.com <mailto:Fernando.Vargas@awc-inc.com> >
Subject: RE: Dynamis 2nd Batch FW: Approved PO's

 

Fernando,

 

Please review below and let me know if you have any questions.  I caught an additional error from them.  After you process all of the orders, send all of the acknowledgements to yourself and draft up an email to Jonathan explaining all of the changes but don’t send it before I review.

 

SO 2773084 (PO1727)

*	part ZBE101 line 5 on has a unit price of 10.71 – they were referencing an old quote, I corrected the SO
*	Line 8: keep pricing how it is, part number\description should be: 

	*	

	*	
	*	Reference my excel sheet on where to purchase and our cost
	*	We need these urgently, please have them shipped UPS Red

 

SO 2773086 (PO1726)

*	line 2 it is 20.87 per their PO – that price is correct
*	Line 10 – Please ship UPS Red

 

SO 2772647

*	confirm if line 3 on needs to be DPC01DM48 – correct these should be the 480V version but please purchase DPC01DM44 <https://us.rs-online.com/product/carlo-gavazzi-inc-/dpc01dm44/71606836/>  instead of DPC01DM48 https://us.rs-online.com/product/carlo-gavazzi-inc-/dpc01dm44/71606836/ <https://us.rs-online.com/product/carlo-gavazzi-inc-/dpc01dm44/71606836/> 
*	line 8 part 2320102 needs to be purchased out as this PO wasn’t on the unit number list. – correct this should be AD 2320102 and purchased from that source on the excel sheet Is there any phoenix material that will be placed normally on order? I believe I have purchased for some orders already.

 

Thank you,

Miguel

 

 

Miguel​​​​ Grillo

Automation Consultant

office

(713) 944‑2100

cell

(713) 446‑2879

Also confirm if line 3 on SO2772647 needs to be DPC01DM48 and if line 8 part 2320102 needs to be purchased out as this PO wasn’t on the unit number list. Thanks,

 

Fernando​​​​ Vargas

I added some deadband, and sometimes it will hold steady for about 5 minutes, but mostly I have this small oscillation. It could be due to the deadband on the valves and how they move. The amount I'm moving the valve to get that change is only like 1.5%. I'll ask the Intune guys tomorrow what they think.

		Hey, Miguel!
		 
		Thank you for your patience! 🙇 
		 
		I'd like to address all the issues you raised.
		 
		First, the recurring subtasks <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/YdSMCW6vkMc6KqYWtL6FIy?domain=help.clickup.com>  that you have are set to recur only when closed. This kind of task will not recur and change the due date unless you mark them as Closed/Completed first. I suggest using the On Schedule <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/TLnfCW6vkMc6KqYWt6LX5M8?domain=help.clickup.com>  setting instead so it automatically recurs even if the current status is still Not Started or Active.
		 
		 <https://clickup.zendesk.com/attachments/token/nu1YZ05i82a5g20YYCCWDzN3C/?name=image.png> 
		 


		Emails from Tasks


		Task details are intended not to be included in emails created from the comments. If you want to include some details from the task, I'd recommend creating an Email Automation <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/kEKWCZ6yqPc7LgRpcmp3rW?domain=help.clickup.com>  to capture the task details and then use that to start an email thread with the task details. Please see the sample Automation below.
		 
		 <https://clickup.zendesk.com/attachments/token/dqjvUCMPuE4nIfLo9xEvwb0pX/?name=2024-03-06_07-59-33+%281%29.gif> 
		 
		Once the Automated email is sent, you can reply to that and add or change the recipient to start a thread with the task details in the email.
		 
		 <https://clickup.zendesk.com/attachments/token/a8EykX1YrLqUUOf44ORvuZFCX/?name=2024-03-06_08-05-11+%281%29.gif> 
		 


		Inbox Notifications


		Please note that actions made by you will not trigger an in-app notification for yourself. If you are sending or forwarding emails to a ClickUp List from your email address, it will not trigger a notification in the Inbox.
		 
		The 99 notifications on the Other <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/7PPJC31vBMuXlKMEc8CT4r?domain=help.clickup.com>  tab means there are 99 notifications about changes in tasks that you are watching. It doesn't necessarily mean the same number of tasks you have in the Workspace.
		 
		You can read what type of notifications you get for each tab here <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/wR8FC4xwENTzO5Wvc8q8Wc?domain=help.clickup.com> . We divided it into different tabs to help declutter and organize all types of notifications.
		 


		Add Guests


		This help article <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/9CggC5yxJOfM79KDI38MiB?domain=help.clickup.com>  has clear instructions on how to add guests. I confirm that you have 10 free guest seats that you can fill.
		 
		Please make sure you understand the difference between full members and guests as adding users as members will charge your account.
		 
		Guests <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/C5iuC68yLPuPvm9BU1yit_?domain=help.clickup.com>  are usually people outside your organization with limited access to your Workspace. They can only see the items you share with them.
		 
		All paid plans <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/D1f8C73zNQtzKN6Jc5D-aL?domain=clickup.com>  let you choose different permission <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/0MmyC82APRIX0qMKcxPOCT?domain=help.clickup.com>  levels for guests and shared items. If allowed, those guests can create and edit tasks. They can't create Spaces, Folders, or Lists.
		 
		Members <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/oyXvC9rBRVIzXqKpcJ7ij8?domain=help.clickup.com>  are the people in your organization who need to use your Workspace actively. They have access to all public items and your plan's features. They can create and edit Spaces, Folders, Lists, and tasks.
		 
		If you want to learn more, check out this article: User Roles <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/oyXvC9rBRVIzXqKpcJ7ij8?domain=help.clickup.com> .
		 


		Closing tasks


		I understand you want to easily close tasks when you open them similar to Notion's task behavior. At this time, clicking outside the task on the sidebar will not close the task. Esc or Escape button on your keyboard is the ClickUp hotkey in closing tasks.
		 
		You can learn more about the other hotkeys here <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/HaFBC0RpvJTk5BWLc1g1Ri?domain=help.clickup.com> .
		 
		I wish you a wonderful day! Contact us anytime you have questions. 🌷

			I'm Alex, a member of ClickUp's Technical Support team, and I'm here to assist you in resolving this issue.
			
			I understand that you have several questions about the email features, comments, notifications, and due dates. I'll answer them all below.
			 
			First, the disappearing due date. I tested it and I was able to reproduce the behavior that you described. 
			 
			We've recently confirmed this as unintended behavior and let our Development team know you're also experiencing it. For individual tracking, I've created a report to keep you updated on our team's progress and completion.
			 
			Here is the Report ID: CLK-475130
			 
			In the meantime, you can set the due date and time after opening the task or on the List view to make sure that they save successfully.
			 
			If you would like to check in on the progress sooner, the easiest way to do this is by entering the above ID into our chatbot in our in-app Resource Center for instant updates!
			 


			Inbox


			Inbox <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/iZ1yCmZ6lrIp3lYrImJMAZ?domain=help.clickup.com>  is actually for ClickUp task notifications and not for email. I understand that you want to send and receive emails in ClickUp and that is done within the tasks. You can find all the information here <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/lF5-Cn5XnvCX2DLYclZqee?domain=help.clickup.com>  and I also created a short video explaining it here <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/Gl7vCo2KpwIDRYG0fGOCnQ?domain=dev-share.clickup.com> .
			 


			Comments/Notifications


			We currently have no way to start a conversation when you are creating a task. We can only start messaging other users once the task is already created in the comments section.
			 
			I get that you are concerned about users being notified when a comment is added to a task. This can be set in the individual notification settings <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/1F_4CpYKrxh9WoLBcORVHV?domain=help.clickup.com> . Please note that actions made by you will not trigger a notification for yourself.
			 
			I created another short Clip explaining this here <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/0RgyCqx5wyT13Nrou0T8bF?domain=dev-share.clickup.com> .
			 


			Due Date Mobile Notifications


			We have to make sure that notifications are enabled on both devices. Please go to you mobile settings and make sure that Push notifications for the ClickUp app is enabled.
			 
			If the settings are enabled and you still do not receive consistent notifications, please let me know. Provide us with more information about the devices such as their model and operating system
			 
			We appreciate your patience and understanding! Let us know if you have other questions. 
			
			I wish you a wonderful day! 🌻 
			
			
			Cheers!
			
			Alex

Also, can I schedule a time to speak with someone and run through a few questions? 

 

Here is a video showing my challenges with the email automation setup.

On March 8, 2024 at 12:19:12 AM UTC, miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com <mailto:miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com>  wrote:

	Hello, this email never made it into my CU list. The email address is correct.

	 

	 

	 

	Miguel A. Grillo

	Automation Consultant

	Houston, TX 77017

	From: ClickUp Support <help@clickup.com <mailto:help@clickup.com> > 
	Sent: Tuesday, March 5, 2024 6:20 PM
	To: Miguel Grillo <miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com <mailto:miguel.grillo@awc-inc.com> >
	Subject: Live Chat Follow-up: Outllook (#1686652)

	 

	Hey, Miguel!
	 
	Thank you for your patience! 🙇 
	 
	I'd like to address all the issues you raised.
	 
	First, the recurring subtasks <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/diYhCADoj0FZPyjNF2To3-?domain=help.clickup.com>  that you have are set to recur only when closed. This kind of task will not recur and change the due date unless you mark them as Closed/Completed first. I suggest using the On Schedule <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/0u0uCyP5QKT7QvYrfZNUYpn?domain=help.clickup.com>  setting instead so it automatically recurs even if the current status is still Not Started or Active.
	 
	 <https://clickup.zendesk.com/attachments/token/nu1YZ05i82a5g20YYCCWDzN3C/?name=image.png> 
	 


	Emails from Tasks


	Task details are intended not to be included in emails created from the comments. If you want to include some details from the task, I'd recommend creating an Email Automation <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/8dyRCERvrnTlzrB3F4AtKR?domain=help.clickup.com>  to capture the task details and then use that to start an email thread with the task details. Please see the sample Automation below.
	 
	 <https://clickup.zendesk.com/attachments/token/dqjvUCMPuE4nIfLo9xEvwb0pX/?name=2024-03-06_07-59-33+%281%29.gif> 
	 
	Once the Automated email is sent, you can reply to that and add or change the recipient to start a thread with the task details in the email.
	 
	 <https://clickup.zendesk.com/attachments/token/a8EykX1YrLqUUOf44ORvuZFCX/?name=2024-03-06_08-05-11+%281%29.gif> 
	 


	Inbox Notifications


	Please note that actions made by you will not trigger an in-app notification for yourself. If you are sending or forwarding emails to a ClickUp List from your email address, it will not trigger a notification in the Inbox.
	 
	The 99 notifications on the Other <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/7RisCKrBKwIDYgL2cyfb_J?domain=help.clickup.com>  tab means there are 99 notifications about changes in tasks that you are watching. It doesn't necessarily mean the same number of tasks you have in the Workspace.
	 
	You can read what type of notifications you get for each tab here <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/Ne4xCL9DMxHkgxLRUGNI2v?domain=help.clickup.com> . We divided it into different tabs to help declutter and organize all types of notifications.
	 


	Add Guests


	This help article <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/4CKfCM8gOyu2LKjqt4p3x3?domain=help.clickup.com>  has clear instructions on how to add guests. I confirm that you have 10 free guest seats that you can fill.
	 
	Please make sure you understand the difference between full members and guests as adding users as members will charge your account.
	 
	Guests <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/dUfpCNkjQziZQKo0FxtUR9?domain=help.clickup.com>  are usually people outside your organization with limited access to your Workspace. They can only see the items you share with them.
	 
	All paid plans <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/spLmCOYkVAhNgV3pcXsARx?domain=clickup.com>  let you choose different permission <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/Ahz5CPNlXBs02YQKFv5j_Y?domain=help.clickup.com>  levels for guests and shared items. If allowed, those guests can create and edit tasks. They can't create Spaces, Folders, or Lists.
	 
	Members <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/3yaJCQWmZDiXKG7kH2VQLl?domain=help.clickup.com>  are the people in your organization who need to use your Workspace actively. They have access to all public items and your plan's features. They can create and edit Spaces, Folders, Lists, and tasks.
	 
	If you want to learn more, check out this article: User Roles <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/3yaJCQWmZDiXKG7kH2VQLl?domain=help.clickup.com> .
	 


	Closing tasks


	I understand you want to easily close tasks when you open them similar to Notion's task behavior. At this time, clicking outside the task on the sidebar will not close the task. Esc or Escape button on your keyboard is the ClickUp hotkey in closing tasks.
	 
	You can learn more about the other hotkeys here <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/g0VPCR6n2EcGp9NvSRV4bd?domain=help.clickup.com> .
	 
	I wish you a wonderful day! Contact us anytime you have questions. 🌷 
	 
	 
	Cheers!
	 
	Alex

 

 

 

 <https://ca.slack-edge.com/E03113FF70B-U03JBQCS0CS-98829fca5a12-512> 

 

 <https://clickup.com/emails/images/brand/v2/logo.png>

See video: https://sharing.clickup.com/clip/p/t9014148638/f3bfa27d-82ff-47b7-9e14-3a9a747217dc/screen-recording-2024-03-04-11%3A01.webm <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/iQBFCYExoOHDvR5Lc8EZEz?domain=sharing.clickup.com>

		Hey, Miguel!
		
		I trust that everything is well with you! 🙏
		
		I'm Alex, a member of ClickUp's Technical Support team, and I'm here to assist you in resolving this issue.
		
		I understand that you have several questions about the email features, comments, notifications, and due dates. I'll answer them all below.
		 
		First, the disappearing due date. I tested it and I was able to reproduce the behavior that you described. 
		 
		We've recently confirmed this as unintended behavior and let our Development team know you're also experiencing it. For individual tracking, I've created a report to keep you updated on our team's progress and completion.
		 
		Here is the Report ID: CLK-475130
		 
		In the meantime, you can set the due date and time after opening the task or on the List view to make sure that they save successfully.
		 
		If you would like to check in on the progress sooner, the easiest way to do this is by entering the above ID into our chatbot in our in-app Resource Center for instant updates!
		 


		Inbox


		Inbox <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/TjaTCZ6yqPc7wZz5fnmQUp?domain=help.clickup.com>  is actually for ClickUp task notifications and not for email. I understand that you want to send and receive emails in ClickUp and that is done within the tasks. You can find all the information here <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/ON1gC1wqxKu60y8MHRug9u?domain=help.clickup.com>  and I also created a short video explaining it here <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/1JUIC2krzLiV4q7phr-0DN?domain=dev-share.clickup.com> .
		 


		Comments/Notifications


		We currently have no way to start a conversation when you are creating a task. We can only start messaging other users once the task is already created in the comments section.
		 
		I get that you are concerned about users being notified when a comment is added to a task. This can be set in the individual notification settings <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/xuHbC31vBMuXP1ZpHlXcqs?domain=help.clickup.com> . Please note that actions made by you will not trigger a notification for yourself.
		 
		I created another short Clip explaining this here <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/6ZsmC4xwENTznNrBTrsCHJ?domain=dev-share.clickup.com> .
		 


		Due Date Mobile Notifications


		We have to make sure that notifications are enabled on both devices. Please go to you mobile settings and make sure that Push notifications for the ClickUp app is enabled.
		 
		If the settings are enabled and you still do not receive consistent notifications, please let me know. Provide us with more information about the devices such as their model and operating system
		 
		We appreciate your patience and understanding! Let us know if you have other questions. 
		
		I wish you a wonderful day! 🌻 
		
		
		Cheers!
		
		Alex

					Link your Microsoft 365 account

					To link your Microsoft 365 account with ClickUp:

					1.	Open any task.
					2.	In the lower-right corner, click the comment field.
					3.	Click the email icon.

	Hey, Miguel!
	 
	Thank you for your patience! 🙇 
	 
	I'd like to address all the issues you raised.
	 
	First, the recurring subtasks <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/diYhCADoj0FZPyjNF2To3-?domain=help.clickup.com>  that you have are set to recur only when closed. This kind of task will not recur and change the due date unless you mark them as Closed/Completed first. I suggest using the On Schedule <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/0u0uCyP5QKT7QvYrfZNUYpn?domain=help.clickup.com>  setting instead so it automatically recurs even if the current status is still Not Started or Active.
	 
	 <https://clickup.zendesk.com/attachments/token/nu1YZ05i82a5g20YYCCWDzN3C/?name=image.png> 
	 


	Emails from Tasks


	Task details are intended not to be included in emails created from the comments. If you want to include some details from the task, I'd recommend creating an Email Automation <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/8dyRCERvrnTlzrB3F4AtKR?domain=help.clickup.com>  to capture the task details and then use that to start an email thread with the task details. Please see the sample Automation below.
	 
	 <https://clickup.zendesk.com/attachments/token/dqjvUCMPuE4nIfLo9xEvwb0pX/?name=2024-03-06_07-59-33+%281%29.gif> 
	 
	Once the Automated email is sent, you can reply to that and add or change the recipient to start a thread with the task details in the email.
	 
	 <https://clickup.zendesk.com/attachments/token/a8EykX1YrLqUUOf44ORvuZFCX/?name=2024-03-06_08-05-11+%281%29.gif> 
	 


	Inbox Notifications


	Please note that actions made by you will not trigger an in-app notification for yourself. If you are sending or forwarding emails to a ClickUp List from your email address, it will not trigger a notification in the Inbox.
	 
	The 99 notifications on the Other <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/7RisCKrBKwIDYgL2cyfb_J?domain=help.clickup.com>  tab means there are 99 notifications about changes in tasks that you are watching. It doesn't necessarily mean the same number of tasks you have in the Workspace.
	 
	You can read what type of notifications you get for each tab here <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/Ne4xCL9DMxHkgxLRUGNI2v?domain=help.clickup.com> . We divided it into different tabs to help declutter and organize all types of notifications.
	 


	Add Guests


	This help article <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/4CKfCM8gOyu2LKjqt4p3x3?domain=help.clickup.com>  has clear instructions on how to add guests. I confirm that you have 10 free guest seats that you can fill.
	 
	Please make sure you understand the difference between full members and guests as adding users as members will charge your account.
	 
	Guests <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/dUfpCNkjQziZQKo0FxtUR9?domain=help.clickup.com>  are usually people outside your organization with limited access to your Workspace. They can only see the items you share with them.
	 
	All paid plans <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/spLmCOYkVAhNgV3pcXsARx?domain=clickup.com>  let you choose different permission <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/Ahz5CPNlXBs02YQKFv5j_Y?domain=help.clickup.com>  levels for guests and shared items. If allowed, those guests can create and edit tasks. They can't create Spaces, Folders, or Lists.
	 
	Members <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/3yaJCQWmZDiXKG7kH2VQLl?domain=help.clickup.com>  are the people in your organization who need to use your Workspace actively. They have access to all public items and your plan's features. They can create and edit Spaces, Folders, Lists, and tasks.
	 
	If you want to learn more, check out this article: User Roles <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/3yaJCQWmZDiXKG7kH2VQLl?domain=help.clickup.com> .
	 


	Closing tasks


	I understand you want to easily close tasks when you open them similar to Notion's task behavior. At this time, clicking outside the task on the sidebar will not close the task. Esc or Escape button on your keyboard is the ClickUp hotkey in closing tasks.
	 
	You can learn more about the other hotkeys here <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/g0VPCR6n2EcGp9NvSRV4bd?domain=help.clickup.com> .
	 
	I wish you a wonderful day! Contact us anytime you have questions. 🌷 
	 
	 
	Cheers!
	 
	Alex

		I trust that everything is well with you! 🙏
		
		I'm Alex, a member of ClickUp's Technical Support team, and I'm here to assist you in resolving this issue.
		
		I understand that you have several questions about the email features, comments, notifications, and due dates. I'll answer them all below.
		 
		First, the disappearing due date. I tested it and I was able to reproduce the behavior that you described. 
		 
		We've recently confirmed this as unintended behavior and let our Development team know you're also experiencing it. For individual tracking, I've created a report to keep you updated on our team's progress and completion.
		 
		Here is the Report ID: CLK-475130
		 
		In the meantime, you can set the due date and time after opening the task or on the List view to make sure that they save successfully.
		 
		If you would like to check in on the progress sooner, the easiest way to do this is by entering the above ID into our chatbot in our in-app Resource Center for instant updates!
		 


		Inbox


		Inbox <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/TjaTCZ6yqPc7wZz5fnmQUp?domain=help.clickup.com>  is actually for ClickUp task notifications and not for email. I understand that you want to send and receive emails in ClickUp and that is done within the tasks. You can find all the information here <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/ON1gC1wqxKu60y8MHRug9u?domain=help.clickup.com>  and I also created a short video explaining it here <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/1JUIC2krzLiV4q7phr-0DN?domain=dev-share.clickup.com> .
		 


		Comments/Notifications


		We currently have no way to start a conversation when you are creating a task. We can only start messaging other users once the task is already created in the comments section.
		 
		I get that you are concerned about users being notified when a comment is added to a task. This can be set in the individual notification settings <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/xuHbC31vBMuXP1ZpHlXcqs?domain=help.clickup.com> . Please note that actions made by you will not trigger a notification for yourself.
		 
		I created another short Clip explaining this here <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/6ZsmC4xwENTznNrBTrsCHJ?domain=dev-share.clickup.com> .
		 


		Due Date Mobile Notifications


		We have to make sure that notifications are enabled on both devices. Please go to you mobile settings and make sure that Push notifications for the ClickUp app is enabled.
		 
		If the settings are enabled and you still do not receive consistent notifications, please let me know. Provide us with more information about the devices such as their model and operating system
		 
		We appreciate your patience and understanding! Let us know if you have other questions. 
		
		I wish you a wonderful day! 🌻

		Hey, Miguel!
		 
		Thank you for your patience! 🙇 
		 
		I'd like to address all the issues you raised.
		 
		First, the recurring subtasks <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/wSqQC82APRIX0zY2HRgfx_?domain=help.clickup.com>  that you have are set to recur only when closed. This kind of task will not recur and change the due date unless you mark them as Closed/Completed first. I suggest using the On Schedule <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/RGDQC68yLPuPv1ypCpLmjlA?domain=help.clickup.com>  setting instead so it automatically recurs even if the current status is still Not Started or Active.
		 
		 <https://clickup.zendesk.com/attachments/token/nu1YZ05i82a5g20YYCCWDzN3C/?name=image.png> 
		 


		Emails from Tasks


		Task details are intended not to be included in emails created from the comments. If you want to include some details from the task, I'd recommend creating an Email Automation <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/1et_CgJK1lFqRmGohJVqMr?domain=help.clickup.com>  to capture the task details and then use that to start an email thread with the task details. Please see the sample Automation below.
		 
		 <https://clickup.zendesk.com/attachments/token/dqjvUCMPuE4nIfLo9xEvwb0pX/?name=2024-03-06_07-59-33+%281%29.gif> 
		 
		Once the Automated email is sent, you can reply to that and add or change the recipient to start a thread with the task details in the email.
		 
		 <https://clickup.zendesk.com/attachments/token/a8EykX1YrLqUUOf44ORvuZFCX/?name=2024-03-06_08-05-11+%281%29.gif> 
		 


		Inbox Notifications


		Please note that actions made by you will not trigger an in-app notification for yourself. If you are sending or forwarding emails to a ClickUp List from your email address, it will not trigger a notification in the Inbox.
		 
		The 99 notifications on the Other <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/ZOVvClYLjqh18AXVFwyGN5?domain=help.clickup.com>  tab means there are 99 notifications about changes in tasks that you are watching. It doesn't necessarily mean the same number of tasks you have in the Workspace.
		 
		You can read what type of notifications you get for each tab here <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/EC0RCmZ6lrIp3AWgtY-u2K?domain=help.clickup.com> . We divided it into different tabs to help declutter and organize all types of notifications.
		 


		Add Guests


		This help article <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/9F6TCn5XnvCX2KmPHoNb2A?domain=help.clickup.com>  has clear instructions on how to add guests. I confirm that you have 10 free guest seats that you can fill.
		 
		Please make sure you understand the difference between full members and guests as adding users as members will charge your account.
		 
		Guests <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/cZkyCo2KpwIDRBvgs33bmV?domain=help.clickup.com>  are usually people outside your organization with limited access to your Workspace. They can only see the items you share with them.
		 
		All paid plans <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/6VcZCpYKrxh9WvAVcZF3o7?domain=clickup.com>  let you choose different permission <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/1LeKCqx5wyT13zXEF4a_Ip?domain=help.clickup.com>  levels for guests and shared items. If allowed, those guests can create and edit tasks. They can't create Spaces, Folders, or Lists.
		 
		Members <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/TLGrCrk5yzirY12kHrwO95?domain=help.clickup.com>  are the people in your organization who need to use your Workspace actively. They have access to all public items and your plan's features. They can create and edit Spaces, Folders, Lists, and tasks.
		 
		If you want to learn more, check out this article: User Roles <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/TLGrCrk5yzirY12kHrwO95?domain=help.clickup.com> .
		 


		Closing tasks


		I understand you want to easily close tasks when you open them similar to Notion's task behavior. At this time, clicking outside the task on the sidebar will not close the task. Esc or Escape button on your keyboard is the ClickUp hotkey in closing tasks.
		 
		You can learn more about the other hotkeys here <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/xfyvCv25KEIE52AYFjfOZX?domain=help.clickup.com> .
		 
		I wish you a wonderful day! Contact us anytime you have questions. 🌷 
		 
		 
		Cheers!
		 
		Alex

			Inbox <https://url.us.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/5ziXCADoj0FZXnEwFpUSqc?domain=help.clickup.com>  is actually for ClickUp task notifications and not for email. Subject: RE: UC-8112A-ME-T-LX-US stock - Cellular network

 

Miguel,

 

I’m assuming you will be using the cellular modem, if so I recommend using Solve, https://solvenetworks.com/  .      We have used Verizon directly, Teal and Globalgig for our SIM cards.  Each have their problems.

 

Solve has a new SIM with  3 carrier + Canada card that uses T-Mobile/Verizon/AT&T plus Canadian carriers.

 

Solve also has good pricing, a really great website  and can set up sub-accounts.  Someone on your IAM team will have to take care of monthly billing, or your customer can just work directly with Solve.   If it’s a small project, I’d push the customer to get their own account.

 

Thanks,
